description:
I cant believe the food at rhis locaton. My wife and I stop the first time as it was the only Mexican food restirant near the location we were at. We really didnt caare where we ate at that moment, cause we were starving. But OMG, were we thankful for the find. The food we've now had 3  times because its beyond delicio. The owner, assistances, and help are very friendly and thank each party before they each leave. If you are looking for really great Mexican food (chef style) you have to check this place out. Also they hust recently open a 2nd restaurant named Papis near Geary downtown City. Stop and enjoy, you wont be dissatisfied.

Ok my wife & I today (a bit since our last visit), but this time we ate at the Geary Papi's the second location (due to a power outage in the first location's area on Hayes). 

I'll tell ya "There is no difference" in the taste of food, quality of food or friendliness of the employee's. I'm telling all, you have to check these mexican food restaurants' out. Both are OMG delicious and well worth your time. Hat's off the the owners for making our drive from Monterey Bay to the City so very much worth our visits !!!!

Absolutely great food !!!!!!! And we'll be back even if the drive is 2.5hrs from home.

Dave
author: Dave S.

description:
4* Papito Hayes
Trendy Mexican food place on Hayes
Good place to stop for meal after SF Symphony at Davies
The place is crowded at all times
The nachos were tasty; guacamole seems overpriced
The steak fajitas were absolutely delicious
Can do add-on protein on salads
The churro ice cream was sinful (ice cream and whipped cream homemade)
Nice beers (Corona on tap) and wines
Good food service
author: Rosquete B.

description:
Great food and margs at high-end in prices. It's a high-end environment and it works.

Not so good for weekday lunch but great for dates.
author: Christine S.

description:
Came for a Cinco de Mayo brunch with some girl friends. I'd love to give more stars for the friendliness of the staff; they let me store the guacamole I made for a party that day in their fridge while we dined and even gave me chips to go! So sweet of them  

Because of that I feel like an ass for my three stars, but the food was pretty mediocre and my Bloody Maria was actually horrible. It was mostly ice water, tequila, with a splash of what they considered to me house bloody mix  but it really just tasted like watered down/blended salsa which is essentially what it was. I know this because I asked for more tomato juice after returning my first and they brought me a little condiment cup of it. 

We ordered the eggs bennie, a quesadilla, and tacos; I'd give them a 6.5 on the flavor scale. Good but not great! With a little love to their recipes (including the guac),  I think it'd really make a difference!
author: Tash B.

description:
I'm on the fence about Papito. 

You have to pay for chips and salsa. The chips last for a hot second... you have to request more, and then wait around quite some time to get them. Let's talk about the margarita - it was so sour and artificial - definitely one of the worst ones I've had! 

Now, onto the main entree...The carnitas enchiladas were good. They are served in a super cute skillet pan and were a nice sized portion. They definitely weren't your traditional enchiladas. There were three enchiladas on a tiny bed of rice and beans, with melted cheese and some pineapple salsa on top. I generally prefer that my enchiladas be drenched in sauce. 

I loved the ambiance of the place - it's small, modern, and lively! Came on a Friday night and was super thrilled that we didn't have to wait too long either. The menu is huge and the service is friendly. Overall, it was a perfectly fine experience, just not sure I'd run back.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Fun place to eat and drink at with a large group! 10 of us were seated after waiting only about 15 min on a Thursday night. If this is your deal, you've gotta get one of their pitchers of margaritas. 2 pitchers gave everyone 1 full drink with a little left over. The group got a mix of enchiladas and tacos, and everyone was relatively satisfied with their order. A couple of us also shared a dish without problems with splitting.

Decent Mexican food, margarita pitchers, and good service all equal me returning at some point.
author: Allie L.

description: The Burrito Mojado is probably one of the best burritos I've ever. had. period. That deliciousness combined with having dog friendly seating outside made this a perfect stop for our weekend lunch.
author: Roshan L.

description:
This was our first visit to Papito Hayes. When we arrived there was currently a wait list but what we appreciated about them was that they let us leave a phone number so we could pursue the shops and come back when the table was ready so we did. When they called they said they had a table and we came straight back. Turns out the table was outdoors and they cannot serve alcohol on the patio.  We went with it because we were starving but I would have liked to know that a, before we left or b, when they called to give us that table.

Once seated the service was extremely slow. Our water was constantly empty with no one around to refill, the food took forever, and no one came to ask how we liked our food and/or if we needed anything.  

As far as the food goes, while not as disappointing as the service, it was still a let down. We had the chips and salsa to start ($3) which were nice because the food took forever, but not worth it in flavor.  I do not feel the need to order these again. I ordered the shrimp quesadilla which was large in portion.  It was tasty but too heavy for lunch (my fault not theirs). My wife ordered two tacos (shrimp and fried chicken). The shrimp was exactly the same as the quesadilla just in a taco without the cheese.  The fried chicken however was terrible. I love fried chicken and was excited to steal a bite of her taco but I immediately regretted it. I am not sure what part of the flavor it was coming from but something about it was extremely off-putting for me. My wife disliked it as well and was not able to eat it. 

While we do not feel the need to go back, the shrimp quesadilla was the best part of the experience.  However, if we did end up there again, I did see many people ordering the burrito (it was huge and looked delicious) I would try that.
author: Danielle B.

description: Good food for a decent price. Definitely would recommend the quesadilla!
author: Michael O.

description:
Our first time here, my husband and I had a drink at the bar and ordered a plate of their Nachos with Steak. We had eaten something a few hours earlier, so we weren't too hungry. We liked the nachos so much, we decided that we will have to return and try other menu items next time we're in the area.

We returned a few weeks later, and had dinner here. We sat in their cramped dining area, not the bar. The tables are really close to each other, so you will be rubbing elbows with other diners if you choose to dine-in. 

We ordered a couple of their Blood Margaritas. I like their margarita 'cause it's not sweet! As for food, we ordered the Queso Fundido with Chorizo to share, the Super Burrito with Fried Chicken for me and Fish Tacos (3) for the hubby. 

You'd think they'd send the Queso Fundido first and let us eat that while it's hot before our main entrees arrived. Noooo. We got both at the same time. So by the time I got to my burrito, it was cold. The Queso barely had any cheese. It was mostly beans. I was really disappointed with the dish. Don't order it. My burrito was good. It had enough fried chicken chunks, so that  with each bite, you got fried chicken. However, it was a tad dry. Needs more sour cream and guacamole. The hubby thought that the fish taco was just okay. He said it didn't have too much flavor. 

I don't think we'll be back for a full dinner or lunch. Maybe nachos and a glass of margarita at the bar. You're better off getting a burrito at El Farolito or fish tacos at Cholita Linda!
author: Hazel C.

description:
3 of us for dinner. Thursday, 5:30pm. No reservation. Luckily with a nearly full house we got the back booth. 

Wonderful folks. Friendly, inviting, attentive, engaging. 

Dining room is pretty basic.  Not fancy. 

Food is just yeoman. My grilled chicken was overcooked & a bit dried out. Side of puréed sweet potato was good, the fried plantain was bananas foster dessert sweet. Guacamole was tasty, just a little too salty. 

My wife liked her grilled salmon. Good size hunk of fish. Side of coin sliced squashes looked stewed. 

Our guest said the chicken mole' enchiladas were good. 

Beer & wine only. Wine list pretty meager with low end supermarket labels. And to miff me off, the $10 glass of Rive Sud rose' costs $7.99 a bottle at trader joe's. That's like a 600% mark-up. 

Flan dessert was pretty rubbery. My wife did not like it.  More for me, thanks. 

Conclusion: just regular food prep & flavors. I cleaned my plate. There are a million restaurants in Hayes valley. I probably will not return here.
author: Tom S.

description:
A friend and I stopped here today for a late lunch. Really vibrant spot with high ceilings, hanging lights, lots of chatter and reggae music on in the background. We were greeted immediately and given a nice two top table in the back. I have to say, the tables are definitely squeezed in there and it can feel quite crowded, but that also adds to the ambience. 

It took about 10 minutes for someone to greet us and take our order. We started with margaritas - I had the regular and my friend got the blood orange. Initially she was given the charred jalapeño by accident - which she figured out after taking a sip (extra spicy!!) but they got one out to her fast once she told them about the mixup. For a starter we shared the queso fundido chorizo and it was good. Served with warm tortilla chips that tasted freshly baked. The entree we decided on were the carnitas enchiladas - they split them for us, which was great! They were delicious! Rice & beans on the bottom, moist carnitas & flavorful toppings. Oh and make sure to try the habanero hot sauce!
author: Alexa S.

description: The queso fundido is seriously amazing! Not that you can go wrong with gooey, melty, cheesey... but, it is definitely something special. I like that the chips are always hot and the salads are delicious, I don't like that you have to pay extra for them though. The margaritas are always perfectly tart, I prefer the traditional to the flavors, but blood orange margarita is good if you like sweeter (and PINK) drinks. The staff here is helpful and I like that the same group of people have been working there for years, they know what they are doing and find a way to stay organized when there is always a line out the door and people squeezing in the bar. Quesadillas, tacos, enchiladas - all tasty.
author: Kimia M.

description:
Omg carne asada quesadillas are a 100% must order. There is so much flavor in every bite, and they stuff them with a lot of vegetables and cheese. 

The guacamole was just okay. I wouldn't recommend it for $10.

The chicken fajitas were amaaaazing! The sauce on the fajitas was very savory, and it was cooked to perfection. 

The churros were eh. Recommend partially but not life changing or anything. They weren't very flavorable but just tasted like fried dough, which I guess that is what a churro is!

Be prepared to wait for a bit on a Friday night and put your name on a board when you walk in.
author: Nadia H.

description: Papito was very kind to allow me to change my food selection when they brought my food out. I changed to the carnitas enchiladas... They Were AMAZING!! Customer Service Was Over The Top!!
author: Latasha W.

description:
We didn't have to wait long at all for a Sunday dinner -- there was just enough time to grab a drink at Dobbs bar across the street and come back.

I ordered the burrito mojado with al pastor and it was good. I personally don't love an overly decked-out burrito, so I probably will get something simpler (like tacos) next time. Regardless, I still enjoyed my food and the service was nice. Outdoor seating was nice and warm with their overhead heat lamps -- perfect for cold SF nights.
author: Lillian B.

description:
Came here for brunch Sunday morning. Its a cool place, but be careful not to miss it. Had huevous rancheros, it was delicious. The food service and presentation is great. Had bloody marie for the drink, it was good as well. The burrito we ordered was a good size and was delicious.
The service is swift, food is good. Parking is the only problem, but can't complain parking in the city. 
It has outside seating as well, but it was all taken so we sat inside. The inside seating was comfortable. I will recommend this place if you like Mexican food. It has a good variety.
author: Love P.

description:
One word: quesadilla. Omg. So ginormous and amazing. That along with a blood orange margarita made my night. 

I went with a classic steak quesadilla while my partner in crime went all out for the fried chicken quesadilla. Yup- you read right, fried chicken. 

Pricing was your average SF and service was great!
author: Leina K.

description:
This spot is delicious!!! We had 4 tacos (fried chicken, carne asada, pastor, shrimp), churros, limonade. My favorites were the shrimp and fried chicken and pastor tacos, and the limonade. Honestly all the tacos were amazing, juicy, flavorful and relatively fair price. This is not traditional
Mexican throughout but flavors were awesome. The churros were good but slightly harder texture than my liking. 

One of the bigger downsides was that the restaurant was extremely loud. At one point I had to step outside for a break. The bathroom is also remarkably dirty and creepy.
author: Maya G.

description:
What's not to love about an establishment where the people behind the meal take the time to actually meet and greet those enjoying it? From the moment we walked in we were greeted by the awesome staff had our drinks brought straight to the table within 5 mins of meeting them. WOO blood orange margaritas!!

Our group ended up sharing the shrimp enchiladas, mole con pollo enchiladas, and pozole rojo between 4 people. For only 3 dishes between 4 people we were thinking it wouldn't be enough but the portions here are massive! Each order of enchiladas came with 4 pieces  served over beans and rice. Both types of enchiladas were delicious and were packed with flavor. The pozole bowl is also bigger than your head so eating even half of the bowl made me stuffed. They do you a favor and add some lime slices, onions, and additional seasoning on the side. And of course we had to get dessert so the churros dipped in chocolate or whipped cream were a great way to end our meal. 

FYI: If you dine outside in the front of the restaurant they can't serve you alcohol 

Papito Hayes has a prime spot in the area so once you're done with your meal enjoy the other places nearby.
author: Keizzel C.

description: Great jalapeño margaritas!! The burritos are HUGE so I highly recommend taking it easy on chips and salsa.
author: Phee F.

description: Good food and very good price for the Hayes area. Staff is very friendly. Their quesadilla is very tasty
author: Tolga S.

description:
This review is for the service and the Papito Salad.

Service 5/5
It was pretty packed inside on a Friday night and a server was coming in and out tending to different tables. There were groups of people outside waiting to be seated and yet he was still very attentive to my boyfriend and me. We were able to order our drinks while waiting outside and sat us at the bar/wall soon after. Super friendly throughout our entire meal. 

Food 5/5
I have had only the Papito Salad with steak both times I've been here, and it is SO good. I'm not sure what they put in it and it's probably (definitely??) not healthy, but I would eat it everyday if I could. I don't eat very much food or very quickly but when I get this salad I get a large one and I shovel it into my mouth. CANNOT wait to go back and order it again!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Picked up a couple of Pastor Taco's from here (2 tacos for $10) .

Pastor- Marinated pork shoulder, roasted pineapple, onions, cilantro salsa verde

I liked their take on this signature Mexican dish. The pineapple and salsa verde combo is solid. They were a little light on the amount of meat which I'm typically not too picky on but here it was noticeable. 

3 star venue for me based on my first visit.

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

author: Rod M.

description:
A good place for solid Mexican fare at quite reasonable prices, especially for increasingly hip Hayes Valley.

Whether you're choosing their apps, burritos, quesadillas, or assorted tacos, you can't go wrong. In particular, a selection of carnitas, pastor, chorizo, and carne asada tacos were all super delish. If you can mix and match items either on your own or with a group, then all the better, as you can try a broader range of all their scrumptious offerings.

Service is friendly and fast, and the prices are very decent given the overall portions, quality, and taste of the fare that you're getting. Definitely worth the visit if other Hayes Valley places are packed with folks, so much so that it'd even be worth a short wait if everything else nearby is full.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Great place to grab a late dinner. I only say late due to their lack of a reservation system. We arrived at Papito at around 6:30 on a Saturday night and were seated around 7:30 for a table of 3. So anticipate a 45min-1hr wait.

We started off with the 3 salsa appetizer-the chips are super fresh and the salsa is bang on, especially the mango salsa. 

Went with a super burrito and it was great! The serving size was more than appropriate and the taste was phenomenal. Others in my party ordered the same thing. 

Nice, small place for good Mexican food. Would go back again
author: Rohan R.

description:
We've been passing this spot forever, it's always packed! Well, at 3pm on a Saturday there seems to be room. The decor is absolutely perfect, feels Latino and modern with the hanging and strung lights, and mural on the back wall. Something more common in Los Angeles or Mexico City, what a breadth of fresh air.

Food was solid. Fish tacos, fresh guacamole and a Pacifico. Delish.

Looking forward to coming back and spending even more time.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
We didn't even get the chance to eat here.. but I came with a party of 8 on a Saturday night expecting a wait. We put our names on the list and 10 minutes later the hostess comes out to get us and told us we can wait at the bar because our table was almost ready! 

We were so shocked, but excited because at this point, we were all starving. They gave us drink menus but we all said we wanted to wait until we were seated to order drinks. 5 minutes later, she comes up to us again and asks if we're going to order drinks? We reminded her no, we want to be seated first. 15 minutes pass and I check in with her to see when our table will be ready? She says she'll check her list and come back, but AGAIN, insisted we order drinks. 

At this point my friend just said okay, lets just order drinks and maybe our table will be ready. We ordered a round and right before we were about to FINISH our drinks (15 minutes later), we check in with her again and she said ughh not sure... so my group finished our drinks and left. 

We all felt scammed and like she just wanted to make SOME money off of us, which is why she kept insisting we order drinks
author: Carrie L.

description: Food and drinks are great. Great customer service . Nice setting. Raul was the best! Definitely coming here again
author: Lupita M.

description: Papito is the best, consistently amazing restaurant in Hayes Valley. The service is the incredible, the food is so fresh, and you will never get tired of eating there. I try something new every time I go and every dish seems better than the last. The staff makes an effort to get to know everyone who walks through the door, which keeps everyone coming back for more. Raul, Dave, Eddie...all the best!
author: Julie N.

description: Since moving to the area it has been difficult to eat anywhere else since finding this restaurant. Raul is one of the best waiters I've ever had, he always greets me with a big smile and knows what to recommend based on what I like. Beyond the service, the food is amazing. Highly recommend.
author: Maxine M.

description: Love this place! Small but vibrant atmosphere, staff is super friendly, no rush at all although they seem to have a constant waitlist for tables. Food is so delicious and fresh that I forgot to take photos of my quesadillas before wolfing it down!
author: see L.

description:
Working up an appetite after a day of shopping in HV. I was looking for something reasonable as my wallet took quite a hit on all the shopping. Papito was calling my name and I'm glad I stopped by!

More than satisfying and much needed nourishment Papito was on point. Ordered the shrimp enchiladas which comes with rice and beans. Cheese galore and the perfect spices on the shrimp made the meal perfect! It says it comes with 4 pieces which I was a bit hesitant but it was a good amount. Although I couldn't finish it, I saved it for dinner. Cool atmosphere with a full bar and the service was great! 

Good spot to check out if you're in the area!
author: Andrew S.

description: To start, I tried their almond horchata on a busy Friday night. I had never had almond milk in an horchata prior and the combination was satisfactory. The silky drink blended well together. Excellent flavors throughout the whole meal. Guacamole comes topped with cotija and house tortilla chips.
author: Erin H.

description:
I enjoyed the happy vibes, friendly service and my blood orange margarita. I'd go back for a margarita and a small bite.

My friend and I ordered too much food; their food seems to be quite heavy and generous. Between the two of us we shared the chips and guacamole, the tuna appetizer (which is what I would order again), and the duck confit super burrito.

A nice twist on the usual.
author: Camille L.

description: Oh wow, the best tortas I've ever had. By far. The bread is fluffy, buttery and the star of the show, but everything in between will knock your socks off. I can't speak to how the fries are but I went with the side salad and the dressing is frickin phenomenal.
author: Alex G.

description:
I've been searching for a "go-to" taco place for years... found it today here! 

Papito is located in an upscale area with great boutiques and restaurants. The restaurant itself was clean, modern, with a twist of culture.

Ordered: various street tacos, oysters, ceviche, fries, and chips. All perfectly balanced and impressive. 

Service: Raul was very patient and generous. His smile shared his genuine warmth and made us feel welcomed. Juanita was also attentive. 

Our favorite were the carne asada tacos and we'll be back again very soon!!!
author: Star K.

description:
Great Mexican food and service! The ambiance is pleasant as well.

I ate brunch on Saturday and thought it was delicious. I never tried their margaritas but they seem popular.
author: Jeremy S.

description: A relatively small place with a few tables out front and decent Mexican food. I sat at the bar and had solid service. I ordered the carnitas burrito mojado with green and red sauce. The portion was pretty big, which was nice, and the green sauce was great. The red sauce was a bit bland and while the carnitas was mostly good, it was a bit too salty. Overall it was decent food and I'd be interested in trying more of the menu, but there are still far better Mexican restaurants around town.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: After waiting an obscene amount of time for another nameless restaurant, Papito took me and my large family into their arms as though we were their own. Not only were they completely accommodating, the food was amazing. I had the carnitas enchiladas and they were pretty dang flavorful. I'll be back and I will let my friends know about this place.
author: Kate S.

description: Great food and excellent service. The quesadillas are amazing. They use some secret sauce (well,actually I think it is cinnamon) that takes them to the next level. The al-pastor tacos are delicious. My family and I keep coming back for more.
author: Ranny H.

description: The staff here is just the best and the food is amazing. Had the best birthday dinner here, Raul and Maria lit the candles and started singing without being asked and it was so sweet! They really made the night extra special, thank  you so much!
author: Naya A.

description: used to be a loyal customer until they tried to rip me off today.  i got takeout and left a cash tip.  the bartender added $5 to my credit card even though i distinctly left cash tip and entered 0 on the bill. this happens so much in sf i'm fed up with sf servers doing this.  bartender was female working sunday 3pm 10/28/18.
author: jeff l.

description: On my weekend noon-ish walks in Hayes Valley, I always passed by this restaurant but stumbled on to other brunch-y places. When I finally gave it a try, I was really surprised by the prices - they were extremely reasonable, especially for the serving sizes. It was a bit tightly packed, with you basically feeling like you're sharing your table with strangers, but I can't blame them, since brunch is such a busy time. But I don't know if I'd feel like it would work to take a group of friends there for brunch one weekend. I was excited to try the breakfast burrito, but I wasn't too impressed with the food - I can't say on another morning out that I would want to choose this spot as my go-to brunch place. I'll probably give it another try, but I'm not particularly drawn to go back at this time.
author: Marites S.

description:
I try to stop into Papitos at least once a week. The food is delicious and the service is even better.  

And although I've tried almost everything on the menu, I usually get two fried chicken tacos.  This place also haa the best Sangrias (Rojo) that I've ever tasted. Whenever I can get one, I do.  If you're looking for a non-alcoholic drink, try the Watermelon Fresca. It is amazing. If I had to choose, I'd say the best thing on the menu is the Fried Chicken Quesadilla. Oh, that and the Churros. Oh My God, the Churros. 

The food is a little pricey, but definitely worth it.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Went here with my boyfriend on an early Thursday afternoon for lunch. We didn't have to wait, which was great. For how small and empty the place was, there was a lot of kitchen noise, dropping dishes, etc. which just reverberated through the space.

The portions were decent, but for Mexican food, the taste was conservative. The Mole didn't have any flavor and same for the tacos. I could have made better rice and beans at home.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Ugh, this place is so cute. It's tinyyyy but I've always managed to snag a spot at the bartop for two without reservations in under 10 minutes. Their charred jalapeño margarita is muy pica and very delicious! Definitely has a kick beyond just the flavor, so if you're not into that, you should opt for their original margarita or the sweet and zesty blood orange. 

Prices are a bit steep but we're in the city people, so what do you expect? The tacos were very tasty (I had carnitas and my lady had veggie) and the quesadilla al pastor was good but the meat could've been trimmed of the fat a bit better. I found the cheese to meat to tortilla ratio to be a bit off, personally, but flavor was most definitely there. The meat was tender and juicy. 

It's definitely a hustling and bustling type of place, so you shouldn't expect to hang out for too long after finishing up, but service is very friendly and won't rush you, while the bartenders are nice as well. It's a warm and welcoming environment, simply not a big one.
author: Alex K.

description: I went here with a group of friends on a Saturday morning and their margarita and bloody mary were not good at all. Tasted like plastic. The breakfast burritos were okay.
author: Laura K.

description:
I actually wasn't planning on going to Papito tonight for dinner. I was craving for ramen noodle (Yes ! I am an Asian that needs her regular dose of noodle soup)

My boyfriend actually has mentioned and wanted to go here for a couple of weeks and he was bragging about how good the burrito is here. So we stopped here for our date this evening. 

First impression: cute place - nice design & definitely giving some credits for the lightning system & decor here  #Preach 

We ordered sangria (hella strong sangria ) you got me at Sangria, Papito  

So my boyfriend suggested us to split the mojado burrito  (3rd choice on that menu) with an add on of grilled chicken.. 

The server brought out a plate & I was like .. how can I split this in half ?  Apparently that plate burrito was already split in half  (check the photo in the photo session please) it is as big as my arm - I swear ! 

Covered with amazing sauce & light sour cream, when you cut and have the first bite of that burrito ? - OMG ! The spicy salsa with black bean and rice along with the well marinated grilled chicken and i think crunchy tortilla inside = Heaven - period
author: Thao P.

description: This place is literally the best. Best restaurant, best service and best Mexican food in the Bay Area. Their steak fajitas are a must as well as their pitchers margs and the churro desert! If Raul is working, I hope you're seated at his table because he genuinely is the cherry on top to your entire experience. Originally from Texas and their fajitas are seriously the best in town. Service is excellent and always worth the wait!
author: Jean S.

description: Awesome! Great food and friendly staff. And the most important thing for me that they welcomed Bamzi (my dog). Couldn't be happier! :)
author: Sanaz M.

description:
It's more like 3.5 but I'm feeling generous as it's the holidays! The place is very hip and industrial. It's classy and has the high price tag too. There is seating out front in the patio, a small bar area, and seated along the side. There wasn't much wait and they recommend all parties arrive before seating.

Since my high from the watermelon sweet tea at Brenda's, I decided to get their watermelon juice. It's so fresh!! My gawd, I wish that's unlimited too! The portions are good sized. A lot of sweet flavor for the hot chicken enchiladas. And the quesadillas are packed with meats. But the best was still the watermelon drink!

The ambiance is really good. The indoor seating has light hanging that makes it somehow feel outdoorsy and rustic and romantic. I think this would be a good 1st date place.  The staff is friendly and understanding.
author: Lana W.

description: We have been looking for a delicious sit-down place for Mexican food since moving to the Bay Area.  This place has solid food and a good amount of choices.  It was quite warm in the restaurant, so not sure if the air was working.  The staff was attentive once we were able to flag them down.  We will definitely go back as it is a short walk to the Orpheum where we often see shows.
author: Dawn R.

description: Extra for chips... extra for jalapeño peppers... pretentious / unfriendly staff who barely acknowledged me... I had three tacos, pastor, asada and carnitas. They were ok - definitely does not justify the price, $5 per taco, as I was charged a total of $15 for the three. If I want good tacos, I'd much rather go to any cheap taqueria in the Mission and it would be better and cheaper than this place.
author: Juan Karlos K.

description: If you're a torta fan like me, RUN--don't walk--and get their Milanesa fried chicken sandwich.  Best torta--hands down--I've ever had.  Bread was fresh with a great crunchy sear from a flattop.  Guacamole and pickled vegetables.  HUGE.  Could not finish it.  Comes with either salad or fries, and I (smartly!) chose the fries.  Hot, crispy and seasoned well with aioli on the side.  Great, friendly service.
author: Monty H.

description:
(This review is for a visit on Saturday, July 15)

A friend and I were walking around Hayes Valley looking for a place to eat and stumbled upon Papito Hayes. We got seated right away (it was a late lunch, around 2 p.m.). The waiter immediately came to us with menus and checked on us twice. The first time he came around we asked for more time, but for some reason he thought my friend said she wanted lemonade. We caught him before he walked away and clarified that we wanted more time, not lemonade (I believe there was a language barrier, so we let it go). Once we were ready I asked for sangria with red wine, but right after he asked "white?" ... no. Anyhow, we ordered the rest of our meal without any other issues.

FOOD: I ordered quesadillas with carne asada ($14) - it was pretty thick and cheesy (just the way I like it)! My friend got two shrimp tacos that were filled and topped with an avocado slice ($10). It was filling! 

DRINKS: I got red sangria and my friend got a classic margarita (they also have a jalapeño margarita! maybe I'll try it another day). Definitely quenched our thirst (it was a very hot day).

I also liked the ambience of the place - it's an open air spot and had a modern, casual look. There's also a cool mural at the back of the restaurant of a woman decorated in roses, reminded me of one of those characters from "The Nightmare Before Christmas" or "Corpse Bride." I would give the service a 3/5 - (it was good - not stellar, but not bad).
author: Jamey P.

description:
I've been to this location in Hayes Valley a few times, as well as the Potrero location and smaller location Papi's in the Tenderloin. 

I will say the service is much better at the other locations, likely because the staff are a bit less busy. However, the food is consistent and fresh across all locations. 

All of the food I've tried (chicken torta, fish tacos, carnitas tacos, corn, chicken tacos, chicken quesadilla, ceviche) has been good - 4/5. But I continue to order the fried chicken quesadilla. 

It will say, it's not "true" fried chicken - more of a chicken cutlet - but it's 1. SO BIG 2. Soooooooo much avocado guys, and 3. Delish AF. 

I usually take it home and get like 2 more meals out of it. And when I say they're generous with the avo, I mean it. Like no other place in the city puts this much avocado in a meal that's not labeled guacamole. No skimping here. 

Soooo if all of those things sound good to you, try this (or any of the locations) out. And how about a spicy marg to top off your meal!?
author: Ainslee S.

description: I've been in SF/Hayes Valley for almost 2 weeks now, and I've already been to Papito Hayes about 6 or 7 times! And no I am not only obsessed with Mexican food, but yes, I am always down for Papito Hayes. The restaurant is sometimes really busy, but the brunch paired along with a pitcher of the spicy margarita are well worth it. I could drink those spicy margaritas all day, and no, that intoxication is not why the food tastes amazing ;) the chorizo omelet is fire and don't forget to try the fresh chips and guacamole. The people who work there are always working hard and are always super nice and considerate. Love the workers, love the restaurant ambience & decor, love the good vibes & solid seevice, and love the food and spicy margaritas :)
author: Alicia W.

description: We walk by this place all the time. One night, we decided to stop by for dinner.  We had to wait about 10 minutes. And got sat outside on the sidewalk. They have like a plastic awning and heaters too so I didn't feel too cold. My bf got the beef fajitas and I had a regular carnitas burrito. My burrito reminding me of something I could get at a fast food Mexican place but for like 150% more. I did like the carnitas - juicy and tender with some pineapple bits. I tried a bite of the beef and it was fine. The fajitas comes in the smallest skillet ever - like 5-6 inches in diameter. Service was fine. Like I said, we were sitting outside so there wasn't always a waiter readily available.
author: Alison W.

description: It was a great place right on our neighborhood. We always come here to enjoy the food and beers. Xingu is my fav dark beer thats why service staff thought that i'm brazilian.Every each my visit "Raul" accommodated us very friendly. Shrimp frisse salad must try..
author: Melih T.

description: First time to go to Papito's on Sunday night with few friends. None of us have ever tried Papito before. Servers were really friendly and hospitable, made sure we were taken care of from the get go. Sat at the bar while we waited for a table to free up, then we ended up sitting outside with all of the heaters on. Customer service was excellent. We only ended up ordering few sides and it was perfect for three of us. We ordered the FRENCH fries, chips and salsa, and the deep fried Brussel sprouts, which were delicious! Loved the whole experience overall, and totally recommend this place!
author: Ruthie M.

description: I ordered them from caviar.  Really good food.  They make it with care.   I'm definitely ordering again.  The veggie quesadilla was awesome. It was worth the higher price compared to the really cheap Mexican places I usually order from.
author: Nick S.

description:
Overpriced. 

Worst seafood ceviche I've ever had. Tried the mole, burrito, quesadillas and they all sort of tasted the same.
author: Ivy N.

description:
Loved this Mexican restaurant. We stumbled across it as we were shopping along the street. Went inside and asked if they took reservations, the waiter said no but then said if I gave him my name and time we wanted etc he could save us a table which was really nice. Arrived at 6pm and as promised, table was ready. 

I love Mexican food so have become very critical of it. We started with guac and chips and the guac is incredible!!! It was a great serving size for 3 people and they replaced the chips without even asking. I would go back purely just got the guac. 

For my main I had 4 tacos, at $18 it's definitely on the more expensive side but worth it. I had the two pork tacos, one duck and one steak. Surprisingly the steak was my favorite, definitely recommend! Giving he restaurant 4 stars though because me and my friend were not keen on the duck at all, to the point where neither of us could finish it. However, the friendly service, guacamole, and rest of my tacos were so great I didn't mind. 

Definitely recommend this restaurant if you want some Mexican food!!
author: Abby B B.

description: 5:30pm on a Thursday evening and we didn't have a reservation.  Hayes Street neighborhood has some amazing restaurants and we decided to give Papito a try.  We were greeted with a smile by a very nice waiter and he led us to the back booth.  I was excited that we got the booth, but then realized we were right next to the noisy kitchen where they were washing dishes.  Oh well.  I was not going to let this ruin my dinner!  We ordered chips and salsa and 2 out of 3 of the salsa's were fantastic.  The 3rd was some sort of oil and something sweet, maybe agave?  Not sure.  Just not my thing.  But the other 2 salsa's were really great.  My two dinner mates ordered mole chicken enchiladas and the roast chicken dinner.  I ordered the grilled salmon.  The salmon was cooked the way I like it, crispy on the outside and nice and creamy in the middle.  Hubby said his grilled chicken was a little overcooked.  They have a few wines by the glass, many of them are cheaper wines we can buy at Safeway, nothing special.  But at least they were only $10 per glass, not $12 or $14.00.  We had the flan for dessert, but it was rubbery and dry.  Not jiggly or creamy.  That kind of surprised me, just not the way I like it anyway.  Service was perfect, the bill was what you would expect in SF, Hayes Valley.  However the food was only 3 stars.
author: Barbara S.

description: I absolutely loved this place! Their jalepeno margarita brought my taste buds to life. I had their skillet and it was absolutely delicious. It's a cool little spot with a great vibe - I can't wait to go back!
author: Maansi D.

description:
10$ for a small pot of guacamole? Good thing my BF loves it otherwise I would be rolling my eyes at that price alone.
We both got the carne asada  plate and you can actually ask them to replace the fries with a different side.
My BF got the salad which tastes like a more amped up version of a Cesar salad which he thoroughly enjoyed.
I got the fried plantains which are one of the best I've ever had. So crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside with a little sweetness.
The Carne asada was medium rare and was so good!
Was definitely full and in a food coma after :)
author: Denise W.

description:
I've been here only a few times throughout the years. I want to like this place because it's a "mexican" food that's close to my workplace.... but every time I go to give it another chance (like every 8 months), I am quickly reminded why I don't appreciate this restaurant. 

Firstly, it's expensive....this wouldn't be a problem if the food was good...or even decent....but somehow,  it's possible to mess up Mexican food. i.e. I ordered the carnitas quesadilla today... it was super greasy and had so much fat. I couldn't even finish it :-(
Also, my regular size horchata was $5. 

The ambiance is cool,  nice decor inside. The service is hit or miss, but i have only ordered to go so that's not a big deal. 

I don't want to be a hater but it's pretty disappointing when you pay $21 for an inedible quesadilla & basic horchata. Maybe I'll give it another go in a few months....
author: Sam C.

description: A+. Reliable, hospitable, and distinctive. Especially love the owner who is so nice and caring. Loyal customer for 3 years and counting.
author: Han L.

description: I tried this place for the first time today. They had great enchiladas and pretty good drinks. I would define recommend this place if you like Mexican food.
author: Ieshea G.

description: This place is pretty good. Modern Mexican, tasty and unique food options, great strong drinks ;) Great for Brunch.  Make reservations or get there early otherwise you'll have to wait for a long wait, but it's worth it.
author: Sandy M.

description: This place is right next to our office so we come here for lunch sometimes. Their food is tasty. I was impressed by their homemade hot sause called habanero. Everything is nice and fresh. I love their tacos, especially the shrimp and the beef.
author: Le T.

description:
Papito Hayes successfully straddles the line separating your neighborhood taqueria from those Mexican places trading in high-end (expensive) Mexican fare, a category I barely understand.  There's nothing wrong with your neighborhood taqueria but when you want a bit of class and grace Papito Hayes fills the void.  

The place is nothing like your neighborhood taqueria.  It's hip and artsy with a bit of sparkle.  Service is on point, friendly and confident without being intrusive.  And the menu stops far short of leaving you wondering what the hell you're doing paying this kind of money for this type of cuisine.  4 of us dined here with a couple of beers (beer & wine only; corkage $20 per bottle) and a single dessert and the pre-tip tab ran a reasonable $20 - $25 per person.  

Homemade Guacamole ($9) looked and tasted lovely and was served along with a basket of fresh tortilla chips.  Salsa was offered only when asked and it was dark red and very liquid and could've been improved upon.  

Whenever I see Queso Fundido on a menu it must be ordered, a habit that'll likely send me to my grave earlier than hoped for.  Papito Hayes' version ($10) was ordered with Chorizo and it was one of the less cheesy versions I've sampled.  Still good, but the presence of black beans cut into the full-on melty cheese experience.

I'm also a fool for Elote (Mexican corn served on the cob).  Here they had none but instead,  had an appetizer called Esquites ($9; grilled corn/sour cream/homemade queso fresco/pico de gallo).  It's served in a ramekin, off the cob, and was warm, satisfying, and a bit sweet.  I still prefer the tart flavors of Elote but if you enjoy fresh corn this will do.  

The meal was rounded off with tacos (2 for $10, 4 for $18) which were, as tradition calls for, small and wrapped in double corn tortillas.  6 were ordered and I sampled none, but my 3 dining partners cleaned their plates.   They did the same with a spicy Chocolate Mousse.  

I wasn't blown away by anything I tried here but I enjoyed all of it, ambiance included.  Prices seemed similar to another business trading in this space, Tacolicious, but Papito Hayes is quieter with less swagger (aka no full bar).  If you're looking for a casually upscale spot to dine in Hayes Valley Papito Hayes should be on your short list.
author: Tracey A.

description: This place is substanitlally larger than the other location.  Burrito has s lot of meat :).   I like papito.
author: Michael E.

description:
Wanted to share a review for the tall, lovely brunette woman working behind the bar section. Didn't catch her name but she had a very calm demeanor and smooth voice. Looked possibly Ecuadorian? 

It was a bit busy in the restaurant and I could tell she had a lot to tend to but still provided prompt customer service.  

I noticed how she took care of who seemed like regulars as she offered exactly what they ordered before they ordered it. She even caught on to a customer's take out order that was taking a few extra minutes and got it out to him. 

Yummy food too :D

Thanks!!
xo
author: Elle V.

description: My wife and I can't say enough good things about Papito. The food is absolutely amazing, the margs are to die for, and you couldn't ask for a better staff. Raul, the manager, and David, the owner, have bent over backwards to take care of us, and the rest of the staff, William, Jorge, Dave, Eddie, and everybody else always make sure we're well taken care of. Make sure to get the guac and the queso fondito with chorizo to start, the steak fajitas (with cheese and jalapeños) or the shrimp enchiladas for your main, and the flan or churros sundae for dessert. Papito will always be our favorite place in the city!
author: Paul J.

description:
So , 3 stars entirely for the food . This is a quick bite place during office hours .
food  wise -  just another taco place . What is more annoying is the customer service . I went alone for a quick bite and was completely ignored . Nobody offered any complimentary taco chips even though they merrily served people sitting next to me ( 5 mts away may be ) . No one bothered to come and ask bout the food or the drink . You just sit, eat , pay and walk out almost like a take away when it comes to customer service . So it's definitely not a place to go alone unless one wants to feel completely ignored or discriminated.
author: Sharony R.

description: Papitos Hayes is family. Friendliest service and great food. Come here and meet the crew! Jalapeño margarita will surely up your appetite. It's hard not to stop by after work, mid-Sunday, or any day/time! I don't know how many times I skipped the gym to dine here and never regretted.
author: Mariana M.

description:
Wow. So much better than I expected. I got the duck confit burrito with everything, salsa trio, and horchata. Duck confit was great! Horchata was exactly right to go with the dish. Two out of three salsas (green and yellow) were unique and very flavorful.

As with any burrito, you can certainly eat 1/2 or less as a full meal.
author: A P.

description: Great service with tasty big portions of food & strong margaritas just how I like it.
author: Ashly G.

description:
3.5/5 for food . 

Ordered Vegetarian tacos, enchiladas , chips n salsa and grilled corn.. less authentic and more American 

1/5 for service 
Entrees came before the appetizers. Took 30 mins to bring chips and salsa and didnt even apologize.
author: Karan S.

description: Great service and delicious food.  I needed to find a quick place for dinner before a talk at City Arts, and Papito Hayes was easy to get seating without waiting.  I decided to order their tacos, which were 2 for $10.  I had the Carnitas and the Pollo empanizado (fried chicken).  They were so flavorful and filling.  I'm definitely coming back again.
author: Karen L.

description: This place is so good, the burrito with green sauce with fried chicken is hella good, but what really makes me come here every Sunday is Raul. He is amazing and always tenders to my girlfriend and I. Raul always makes sure we are comfortable, reassures if we need to make changes to our meal if we don't like it and stays on top of cultivating the best environment for us. I don't only look forward for the delicious food but I look forward to seeing our good friend Raul. Every Sunday we try and bring a party of friends to introduce them to Papitos cause we really enjoy our experience every time, and we want them to experience it too. Every time Sarah, Julio, the bartender and Raul always makes sure we are set. Big fan of papitos, and the employees. I believe the managers name is David, I've met him a couple times and he is also great and accommodating. Big ups to this place, please check it out and you won't regret it.
author: Bryan D.

description:
We were seated quickly. Then the wait began. The guy took our orders and then we were forgotten. 

We waited for about 15 minutes and then flagged someone down to at least bring us some chips. 

The chips and salsa were just okay. 

Then we waited. And waited. And waited. 

The two tables next to us, came after us, finished the chips and were half way thru their meals when I finally asked where the heck was our food? We'd ordered a quesadilla and a carne asada. He said it's coming, it was taking longer for our food to come cause I asked for my steak to be cooked medium and that takes longer. 40 minutes long??? 

It doesn't take 40 minutes to cook a steak the size I got. (See picture). And the steak was way well done and chewy. The fries were good. The spicy sauce was good. 

The waiter really didn't care.
author: Wildeflower M.

description:
Sought this place out on my SF trip after seeing the reviews. Overall not impressed & wouldn't go back..
The wait was long. Wanted to sit inside but there was no room. Got seated outside where thankfully they have a heater above the tables. 
Food came fairly quickly but it wasn't good. I got Asada tacos and they where just bland and blah. The queso dip was just basic. My husband really liked his chicken mole enchiladas but I had a bite and didn't like those either.
Wait staff & bartender where all friendly, but overall not worth it for me to go back..
author: Mar D.

description: Good decor and atmosphere. This place wins the award for the worst ceviche I have ever had. Salsas were pretty bad also. The one star is because they burnt hot peppers, made the whole restaurant cough for five minutes and did not even apologize for it. Would have liked to like it but it was just blah.
author: Axel E.

description:
I love Hayes valley and almost all places which are here. We stumbled onto this place and this serves really good burritos, tacos and salmon with Mexican rice. The guacamole was fresh and chunky. Corn starters were amazing, I loved that but then I am a corn lover. 

We ended our meal with churros which were great! 

A good Mexican restaurant which is good for vegetarians too. Service was good and holiday decorations made everything around pretty.
author: Ramyata M.

description:
Enjoyed their Grilled Chicken with Salsa Tomatillo dish. 
It comes with Sweet Potatoes purée but I exchanged for veggies because I'm just not fond of sweet potatoes.
It also comes with Fried Plantains, which I love how they make them!

Love their Churros, too!

Clean environment and customer service is good.

---------
7/21/16
Today I tried their Grilled Steak Enchilada for the first time. First of all, the presentation is attractive and tempting. The taste is definitely a winner. I love that it has all sorts of stuff in it like there's a surprise to every bite. The sauces were delicious, too.
Ordered the Fried Plantains again :)


4/20/17
Their salmon with veggies is delicious!

5/5/17
Came back today with two co-workers. We ordered two main dishes and one dessert to share. I let them choose. One ordered Shrimp Quesadilla and the other Pork Carnitas Enchilada. Both delicious! There's a freshness to their dishes so I don't get tired of them. But I think these two dishes combined too fresh for me :) 
We should have asked for nachos to add crunch (texture) to our meal :)

5/23/17 
Tried their Chicken Quesadillas today. Awesome! Taste great with cabbage slaw and avocados.
My co-worker tried their Shrimp fajitas. I like that they give to lots of good-size shrimps. I think the sauce is bit too tasty though. However, I tasted it without the matching rice/beans and tortilla so it could taste better with these.
Lastly, avocado salsa taste great!!!!!
author: Ariene S.

description: We can't stop coming back to this place! The food is quick, reasonably priced and great service! Try the cod burrito - most definitely my favourite! The guacamole is also excellent! Also sit outside if you can - its warm because of the heaters and great for people watching!
author: Lauren A.

description: First time at Papito for brunch with friends. We sat right away as there was no line or morning rush yet. Staff was very friendly from the start which is partly why I am giving as high of a rating as I am. We all ordered different meals -- and all of them were just so so. Nothing spectacular. I had the breakfast burrito and I added carne asada. Meat was so chewy and burrito was served with Mexican rice, black beans, and eggs only. The Mexican rice didn't cook all the way so it was gritty in my teeth, and the meat did nothing for me. You can find better food like this at local taquerias. For a breakfast burrito, it's hard to screw up, but I ate less than a quarter of it and then gave it to a bum. My friend ordered the shrimp omelette which staff raved about. I tried a bite of hers and it too was so so on the flavor scale. We kept getting whiffs of dirty dish rag smell when we would drink from our water cups. It just wasn't what I was expecting and I probably won't return. Flip side -- great drinks! Blood orange mimosa was light and flavorful with natural juries. Overall-- Sub par food, fine service and good for a drink. Don't waste your time for quality Mexican food. Head to the mission or a taqueria.
author: Emily A.

description:
If you Want real Mexican food find a taqueria or whatever! Save your money and go to Taco Bell
Will never return.
author: Alonso G.

description:
Y'know, I have yet to have a full-fledged meal here probably because it's always packed with the smartphone-addicted youth that characterize the short-term wealth found among the tech-heads who inhabit much of Hayes Valley. I can never convince Jamie W. to come here because one whiff of the Twitterati makes him convulse and go directly to the nearest Chipotle. At least that's what happened when I suggested we try it as I noticed a rare vacant table on a Thursday evening (photo: http://bit.ly/29vxFjq). Alas, we went our separate ways for a couple of hours since I wasn't in the mood for a carnitas burrito bowl and decided to be petulant about it. I deserve a good pout now and then.

The menu was pricey but rather pleasing, not a surprising combo given the penny-foolish clientele. I decided the $11 Jicama Salad would suit my appetite for a quick dinner. It was a fresh mix of flavors that reminded me a bit of a mangonada - Mexican jicama, supremed orange slices, butternut squash, cantaloupe, sliced watermelon radish, and carrots doused in a subtle shallot vinaigrette. Although a bit paltry, the $3.50 extra I paid for a quartet of grilled shrimp lent a nice beachy vibe to my salad (photo: http://bit.ly/29h7OuM). Someday I'll come back for the tacos, enchiladas or quesadillas, but I'll have to convince Jamie that he won't be contaminated. Twitteritis, y'know.

FOOD - 3 stars...a fresh jicama salad but a bit small for the price
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...not as crowded as it usually is
SERVICE - 3 stars...serviceable I guess
TOTAL - 3 stars...Mexican food reinvented for the smartphone set
author: Ed U.

description: I was so supposed by my meal here. The guacamole was amazing and I don't even really guacamole. I got fajitas and thought it was so different but so good. It was saucey and yummy. I can't wait to go back.
author: Tina L.

description: Great food ! Best Mexican food in Hayes Valley. Good place to go with 1 or 2 people any more it might get a little difficult to find a seat.
author: Brian N.

description: Five of us were hoping to get a table before a concert at the Jazz Center. We were greeted with a friendly hostess and were seated within minutes. The service couldn't have been better. The food was amazing! The margaritas had a spicy salt which was different but good. The shrimp quesadilla was outstanding! Everyone completely enjoyed their food. I will definitely return!
author: Roni H.

description: Absolutely delicious food! The prices are good considering the big portions and quality food you receive! Service was great, we were lucky enough to get a table straight away. Make sure to try their chipotle aioli it's bomb!!!!
author: Taleen K.

description: Came here craving some chilaquiles. The plate was pretty, but it was not good, especially for the price. Rice & beans were separate (an additional $4 each) & the egg was extra! Who charges extra for the egg?! What are chilaquiles with no egg? It's a nice spot & staff was friendly, but the food is not real Mexican. Way overpriced for super bland food.
author: Angelica C.

description:
I love this place!

Everything is made to perfection from their salsa, tacos, burritos, salads to grilled chicken entree (their side mashed sweet potato is to die for!)

Must EAT in Hayes Valley!
author: Alice I.

description: Service was good, wait shorter than expected. We had tacos, carne asada (our fav!), ceviche, homemade flan, and several margaritas. All food was good and recommend. I tried the jalapeño margarita, which she warned me was spicy so I asked they mix half and half w regular mix. Glad I did, just what I was looking for. It's a small place but they turn over the tables fast. We had our food really quickly.
author: Renee M.

description: Papito is one of my favorite places in San Francisco. It is the watering hole for myself and my friends- we truly love it. The food is always amazing and we love the service. Generous portions,  good atmosphere, it's fun. Papito- te adoro, las colombianas que siempre vienen a comer aquí los aprecian un montón y solo queremos que sepan eso!
author: monica t.

description: After seeing CCA graduation. We we're looking for something to eat. Found this place. Complete with sugar skull mural. Excellent service, great atmosphere and of course the food!!!
author: Gary H.

description: Came here for lunch, great service! I ordered the guacamole and the fires chicken tacos.  I know everyone seems to love the guacamole...I thought it was average.  I believe it was made early, then put in the fridge...it tasted like it, and was very watery at the bottom.  For the price I would skip the guacamole.  The fried chicken tacos were awesome, I would go back for them!!
author: Sacha S.

description: I have eaten here twice - once for brunch on a Sunday and then again for lunch. Both times the food was good and the service was friendly. Today I had the shrimp salad which was nice - frisee and grilled shrimp with avocados and tomatoes. Everything was fresh, the salad was perfectly dressed. I recommend this place.
author: Tom F.

description: Very good tacos.  The guacamole is great, I love the decor too. Nice for a quick and simple bite.
author: Xander M.

description:
This was my second time at papito Hayes. I actually like their foods. But the service my friend and I got last Friday was appalling. Yes we were in our sweats, but I don't think papito asks for black tie attire. Server poured water for tables next to us but not us as if we were graduates from hogwarts who can use magic to pour water. And when we were still drinking margaritas, another server was rushing us to leave. No I don't have private jets or a fancy car, but I can afford this meal, and since I'm paying I deserve some decent service, which papito Hayes failed to render. Is it because our sweats? Or I hate to say it our race???

And I remember first time I was there we got free chips, this time there was nada. I'm not sure if papito stopped doing that, or they just serve that to royals sitting next to us?
author: Jun W.

description:
Raul is the best host with an amazing personality. Food and drinks are good and 100% recommended. Always a pleasure to come and share a good time in Papito and with the amazing staff. 

-Nico posada
author: Nico P.

description: The burrito tasted good but the chips came with salsa tasted like cleaning product. A few hours later I felt like I had food poisoning.
author: Victor W.

description: I got the al pastor super burrito to go for lunch and it was massive but the best thing ever. The pastor has pineapple in it and it is life changing. The service is fast and friendly but the food overshadows all of that because it is simply that good.
author: Jazlyn H.

description: Love this place! One of the few places in Hayes Valley you can get a table for lunch for a good size group. The food is always delicious and comes out promptly. I usually get the Papito Salad with grilled shrimp and it's a nice,  healthy, filling lunch. My coworkers and I also love the margaritas, they always have new flavors to try. Ceviche is good, too!
author: Tori M.

description: I got the asada enchilada and it was just alright for the price. Pretty filling but I wasn't a big fan of the rubbery texture that the tortilla had.
author: David K.

description: Everything is really good, service is super fast, baja and shrimp tacos just amazing. Will come again asap!
author: Guler Y.

description: If you're looking for tasty pozole, this is the place to come!!  Also, BEST MICHELADAS EVER!
author: Gabriela A.

description: If you are in the area make sure you stop in. Food is amazing! I got a super burrito, it was good sized crispy tortilla black beans and pico. My fiancé got the quesadilla and she loved it. The guy next to us at the bar ordered a chocolate moose and it looked heavenly.
author: Ian P.

description: After discovering Hayes Valley for the first time last weekend, I came back with friends for brunch and decided to try out this cute Mexican restaurant. Papito Hayes is really nicely decorated and has a ton of options on the menu. Everything looked and smelled delicious, but I went with the carne asada tacos. The meat was delicious, if the tacos were a bit small, and my friend finished every bit of the giant burrito he ordered without complaint. I would love to go back and try other dishes that sounded great.
author: Sara P.

description: Very centrally located in the Hayes Valley. Water was provided right away. Chips come with 3 salsas. Guam was freshly made with tomato and Cotija cheese. Jicama salad
author: Kitty D.

description:
Came here with a date and had a glass of zin, a glass of cabernet, the veggie tacos, and guac.  My tacos were okay...nothing special. Really liked the glass of Cabernet but wished the guac was spicier...not much flavor. The chips were tasty, though. 

The places was packed, though.  I arrived around 5 and it got more and more crowded as the night went on...luckily we got a table! 

May return again but I think there are other Mexican restaurants I would like to go to that are more flavorful.
author: Monica J.

description: Best fajitas I've ever had. The service was fucking excellent, and quite affordable for the level of quality we had! Nice night out in Hayes Valley
author: Chris B.

description:
4 1/2 Stars! Papitos came recommended by my dining partner in crime! (Mi chicita from another mamacita!) 

We walked over after work, hungry and stressed out from a long work day, we sat at the bar, which were the only 2 seats left available (around 6pm-ish), Thursday! We immediately ordered 2 Michelada's; Lime juice, a secret tomato and spice concoction and beer with a red salty rim. I felt it to be too spicy, similar to the spiciness of a Bloody Mary. (I have had better). 

Food: 
Chips and guacamole - so good, you can tell it was fresh!
Taco's: skirt steak and shrimp! Excellent! You can taste the quality if the meat and shrimp, we both enjoyed it. 
*Enchilada: chicken mole with rice and black beans. We loved it! 
The waiter recommended the enchilada as it is the "most favorite and most ordered dish on the menu!" 
We told them we wanted to share so they split the enchilada in two separate plates for us! Awe, so nice! And oh boy their portion size was plentiful! Neither of us could finish. 
Churro's : crispy on the outside, soft on the inside with a special homemade whip and chocolate dip! We couldn't finish our meal, but miraculously we finished our dessert! 

Service was great, our waiter was very kind, and patient with our indecisiveness and always smiled. (I loved his accent, too!) 
I liked the environment, although it's a small restuarant, it's cozy and hip and seemed to be very busy on an early Thursday evening. 
Papitos is located in the very trendy Hays Valley on Hayes st. Street parking available. 

I also found our $65 bill was reasonable for the amount of food and drinks we ordered. 

Thanks Papitos,  for a fun experience! We'll be back again!
author: Anie L.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE! I have dreams of their fried chicken tacos which are absolutely delicious. Recently went in and got the elote for the table to share which was light and so yummy as well as the Burrito Mojado with fried chicken. This is the largest burrito I have ever seen and I had leftovers for the next day even though I shared with a friend!

The ambiance is also very cute and perfect for a date night or just a catch up with friends and with so many bars nearby its the perfect place to go before or after some drinks.
author: Rachel N.

description: This is my favorite place to eat in the city!! When I worked in the city I came here everyday! Now I work in Marin but every time I come to the city... I never ever think about not coming here! Love the food! And love the staff!!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Margaritas solid - go with the Jalapeño. Split the carne asada quesadilla and  fried chicken tacos - stuffed!!! Other one with us went with jimica salad with shrimp - healthy and she said a bit spicy - Ssssssss...!!  Service 5 star -atmo cool diner vibe in heart of Hayes Valley. This place gets it Done Son!!!!!
author: Matt T.

description:
4.5 stars. 

Cute Mexican spot in Hayes valley with fresh ingredients, good music (buena vista social club when were there last time), with breezy and chilled vibe. 

No reservation taken here. During the weekend, it's good to come here early or late. We stopped by in late afternoon for a quick bite and sat at the bar. 

Pozole soup was the ultimate comfort food with tender chucks of pork and cabbage (which gives it crunch and structure). A side of condiments of onions, chili, and lime helps you to adjust the taste to your liking. 

I had a side of vegetables with pepper, cauliflower, and onion. The veggies are fresh, flavorful but not over-cooked. I liked the spicy kick in the dish to wake up your taste buds. Good portion - great to share!

My fiancé also had the shrimp salad and the shrimp was large and fresh - grilled to perfection. 

Fantastic value and we were in-and-out in less than 20 minutes.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Really cute little place in Hayes Valley with delicious food and friendly service. Vegetarian and gluten-free menu options are clearly marked. Prices are very reasonable for SF. I had the quesadilla vegetariano. It was an interesting combination of vegetables, cheese, and sauce that tasted great together. (The lighting in my picture is weird because we were sitting outside under the heat lamps, but you get the idea!) Will definitely be back.
author: Erin V.

description:
Always a fave in the city! We love taking people here because it's in a cute walkable area in the city which is perfect for walking off the food right after.

We love the food, even though it is more expensive than you're average taco shop, they have a lot of unique dishes here that are fusion and bring extra added flavorful! Like the quesadilla with pineapple in it... YUM!

I've ordered:
- The Pozole
- Salad w/ Shrimp
- Mojado Burrito w/ Carnitas
- Salsa Trio
- Tacos
- Michelada 
- Margaritas 

And I would honestly order it all again! My faves are: the burrito (it's huge, hardy and flavorful) and the Pozole! It's a bit spicy.

Oh and I love love love the Micheladas here!!!!
author: Anastacia W.

description: Excellent food and service. Recommend the charred Jalapeño margarita, guacamole and vegetarian quesadilla.
author: Donna T.

description: In this city, you can get cheap, tasty and hearty Mexican food for half the price. Soup of the day  ($14) - basically spiced up water with a few stray veggies and shrimp, flan was a half a thimbleful of sugar. After spending $30, I went home and ordered dinner.
author: Sandy C.

description:
Boy was this place overpriced, but as expected for a San Francisco meal! 

I came with a party of four, and we got seated promptly. We got the sangria, which was strong and had a good ratio of fruit. We got the queso fundido with chorizo as the appetizer- which was amazing! (with the chips served). It was literally just meat, cheese, and beans, but really flavorful!! For my meal, I got the carne asada enchiladas which was served in this really deep dish. The dish as a whole was great, but lacked a little on presentation. The tortillas soon began to fall apart and I found myself abandoning the tortilla all together. The carne asada + beans were really the winners!!! 

I'd definitely come back, and you should too if you are in the area!
author: Monica S.

description:
Generally this place is pleasant with an upbeat vibe. Open kitchen, cozy seating, and several items on the menu that read as mouth-watering. We ordered the seasonal passion fruit margarita which was definitely tasty but didn't really have the kick of tequila you get in other similar restaurants. We also started with the esquites: grilled corn, sour cream, homemade queso fresco with a heirloom tomato pico de gallo. This was very tasty but quite small for a $9 appetizer. I ordered the quesadilla made with skirt steak, grilled onions, and avocado. Sounds delicious right? Unfortunately the flavor just wasn't there. With something like steak you really want to taste that char, the seasonings, and the juiciness. This one was just kind of bland. It didn't have that special something you get with really well made steak and carne asada. We finished with the churros sundae and both the house-made Mexican chocolate ice cream and strawberry 'sorbet' were fantastic.

Overall the experience was fine but I was literally sitting 8 feet from the grill, feeling the flames flare up every so often. That sound creates an anticipation for really great meats and sadly the steak was just very weak overall.

Our server was just fine, attentive, not overbearing but the busser needed to really chill out. Our appetizer plates were taken right out from under our noses without even being asked and we still had a bit of esquites left. His arms would be reaching in and whizzing by my head so quickly and unexpectedly, it was annoying and definitely brought down the quality of my experience with my friends.

Although overall my experience was fine, I did say last night that I don't think I'd go back again.
author: Thomas K.

description:
Bland Mexican food made for Anglo-American yuppies.

Horchata's good though.
author: Sergio P.

description:
On a busy Saturday afternoon, Papito was able to accommodate a group of four on short notice. If you've ever been inside this location, four people is a large table.

I've enjoyed their tacos and apps before, this time I had a shrimp burrito. Plenty of meaty seafood within and goes great with guacamole.

Servers are awesome, on the cheeky side which I like. Nothing too over the top, makes you feel like you're dining with friends.
author: Abby S.

description:
I'll keep this one brief... This place is slightly above average. I was craving Mexican, and found it, although somewhat disappointing.

First, the Blood Orange Margarita is amazing. Up there with nectar of the gods.
The fresh made guacamole is delicious, and evokes comfort.
The carnitas enchiladas was a disappointment, with a only a couple chunks of pineapple and rubbery tortilla shells.

It's in the hip part of the Hayes Valley and easy to find. Service is good and efficient. Food was both great and OK, so that's why it gets 3 stars.
author: Roger G.

description:
Not your typical Mexican restaurant! No reservation accepted, first come, first serve. 
We came here with party of three on a Saturday night, got seated without much waiting. We were seated outside with dim lit candle on the table, very romantic date spot as far as I can see. 
We started with guacamole as our appetizer, it has some cheese on it but still tasty. 
I ordered shrimp quesadilla as my main dish. The shrimp was perfectly grilled with right amount of cheese. What made this quesadilla special is the granny smith apple chunks in it. The tart and slightly sweet apple compliments the shrimp. I highly recommend this dish to anyone!
Service is on point and our waitress is attentive and checked on us several times.
author: Christine L.

description: I came here for lunch with 4 friends and it did not disappoint! We started with the nachos which had the perfect amount of sauce and cheese. I ordered the vegetarian taco and the cod taco which were both good but the cod taco was a bit more bland that I would have liked.  However, I really liked the texture because it was crispy which went well with the soft tortilla. One of my friends ordered the el pastor super burrito and he said that the toppings were well distributed within the tortilla and the tortilla was perfectly crispy. The meat was juicy, flavorful and marinated and there were pineapples to add a sweet touch. Another friend ordered enchiladas with shrimp and she said that the ingredients were tasty and fresh. However, it would have been even better if there was more shrimp.
author: Rebecca L.

description: We got the four tacos for $18, shrimp ceviche for $14, and chips and salsa for $3. Everything was fine , nothing stood out. Overall it's just okay and a bit overpriced. Would not recommend. Service was good.
author: Lauren R.

description: Stopped in on Friday lunch 7/28 with a party of six. Employees could not have been nicer and super accommodating all with a great attitude. The food was also very good, we like spicy so needed the HOT habanero sauce which was excellent.
author: Keith S.

description: Delicious food and friendly and efficient staff .  Two taco's and a great margarita was all I needed before our heading to the Symphony.
author: Andrea A.

description:
Amazing!! I'm not typically an Enchilada type of person and mole has never done it for me, but the waitress told me to try the Mole Enchilada and it changed my life. I'm addicted. 

The guacamole and queso fundido were also fresh, full of flavor and just awesome. 

I'd probably skip the ceviche though. No one does ceviche like Peruvians so let's leave it to them :). 

The rest of my party's plates were delicious, but we all agreed-- Mole Enchilada... Life changing.
author: Vanessa L.

description: I love this place. Good portions and wide variety of food selection. Beautiful location in Hayes Valley-- nice date ambiance. This location is more spacious and intimate than the Potrero Hill location.
author: Cassie J.

description:
We are Latin and super picky about Mexican food, because my mom was such an amazing cook. I was so happily surprised that the food here in soooo good. Incredible and delicious. 

We had guacamole (nice and thick and chunky, fresh), carnitas (Mmm, such good flavors, not dry at all) and the baby corn, heirloom tomatoes, sour cream appetizer (so good and sweet!) 

We will be regulars here. That's for sure!!
author: Kelly M.

description:
The food was just "OK" and that's just not good enough for SF. There are so many places in SF that offers way better Mexican food (especially at the price point of Papito). 

If you are in the neighborhood, go elsewhere - plenty of other restaurants to choose from.
author: F. P.

description:
The vegetarian tacos were amazing. I also got a shrimp taco which was tasty. My husband said the super burrito with duck was the 'best burrito [he's] ever had".

Service was nice and quick and though it was busy, it didn't take long for our food, nor did it feel claustrophobic.

The margaritas are organic and fantastic. I had th jalapeño one and my hubs had the regular. Comes with a chili salt rim. Yum!

I will definitely come back!
author: Krystee M.

description: A very stylish location, with a nice Mexican touch. Everything we ate and drunk was super delicious, can recommend the Margaritas for sure!
author: Christina S.

description: For what it is, this place is great.  The location, service, decor... all great.  The food is delicious, but compared to other Mexican restaurants in SF (Mission) the food is overpriced and lacking big flavors.
author: M C.

description: Came here on a whim on the way home after shopping downtown. Got 2 pastor tacos and the churros for dessert. The tacos were flavorful and good portions. The churros were fantastic and came with chocolate and whipped cream dips. I think there was condensed milk injected into the churros as well to make it a bit sweeter which I enjoyed. Bartender was great and food came out in a reasonable amount of time.
author: Alison M.

description: Came here, had two tacos (very good) and a Coke, $11 +.  3 tacos and a drink at my local taqueria, under $10.   Good food, OK service, just not a bargain.
author: James H.

description:
Was looking forward to this place because it had 4 stars on yelp.

We were a group of six, sitting pretty cramped, right by the door w a draft. This is not a good place for larger groups.

We started with 4 appetizers thinking we would also get some entrees (all shared family style). 

Queso fundido - they need to call this a bean dip instead of queso, bc it is a layer of cheese on top and then a bunch of mashed beans underneath. Would not recommend if you're looking for real queso.
