This is a breath of fresh air for the San Francisco Mexican food scene. This is not your average hole in the wall Mexican place nor is it pretentious. The food is always excellent, the service is always friendly and attentive. 

A+
author: Emily S.

description:
Have you ever wanted the same quality of food that is served at Little Chihuahua, but slightly cold and marked up 35%?

This place is for you!
author: Justin P.

description:
A friend and I dropped in here for lunch today. Everyone was friendly and the service was great :)
We tried the salsa trio, which I loved.
We also shared two tacos, fried chicken and chorizo. Both were super yummy and were surprisingly light! Loved it!
author: Lee A.

description: This place was amazing couldn't have asked for a better experience.  We got seating immediately and we're welcomed by a wonderful staff and homey decor. I loved the lighting inside and the service was wonderful. As far as the food goes we were blown away, we ordered the duck tacos which were phenomenal and the shrimp enchiladas to share, they even split it for us ! We finished off with the pineapple sorbet topped with a churro and grilled pineapple which finished off a wonderful meal. We appreciated the servers who were incredibly polite and understanding also.
author: Dawn C.

description: Delicious, high-quality Mexican food in a comfortable environment. It's not my favorite taqueria (in fact, I wouldn't even call it a taqueria), but it deserves 5 stars because I have thoroughly enjoyed every single meal and experience I've had here. Good service, fast take-out orders, reasonable prices, and just super tasty, generously-portioned, high-quality food.
author: Chris M.

description:
Came here last August on vacation. Waited for a glass of water which took almost 40 minutes. Saw the waiter once to take our order. The poor busboy had to bring us our dinner, refill our drinks and bring us the check. Horrible service, decent food.

Update: The business owner sent me this message"your reviews sucks get a life" A couple times now with different names and accounts, it has become harassment. Maybe he should train his staff in providing quality service instead of harassing customers on yelp.
author: Davide L.

description: My husband and I stumbled upon this restaurant in Hayes Valley. We went in for a bite to eat where we ordered their Homemade Guacamole with chips, a couple of tacos and margaritas.  The foods was very tasty and drinks were good. I had a shrimp taco with cilantro, guacamole, apple, mango and salsa. It was delicious!! Took one bite and it was full of flavors. My husband appreciated his pastor taco as well.  Excellent balance of flavors! The wait staff was very friendly and the food came out fast. Overall the place is great. I love the mural of the Dia De Los Muertos portrait on the wall and Salsa Tunes!!
author: Becky K.

description:
I love this place and have never been disappointed.  This isn't your hole-in-the-wall Mexican joint.  This isn't your basic over salted chain place either.  Coming from a coastal town in southern California that is known for it's fresh Mexican fare, I have struggled to find a San Francisco counterpart that could hold up to the incredible Mexican dishes that I enjoyed for so many years.

The hunt is over.  I have tried places all over this city and none of them have the culinary creativity, the fresh flavors, and the delicious drinks that pair so well with the menu items.  I am blown away.

There is so much to recommend.  For drinks, the blood orange margarita is fantastic. For appetizers, I love the corn esquites, the salsa trio, and the tuna enchipotlado (tuna tartare ceviche, basically) are my favorites. For entrees, the chilaquiles, the enchiladas, and the (huge) quesadillas are all fantastic.  The tacos are good; too, but not as remarkable as the other items (you can get a good taco at a lot of restaurants, but they don't all do enchilada carnitas like this!!).  

The service staff is very friendly and the atmosphere makes you feel like you are on vacation somewhere far away from a city like SF.  I highly recommend it!
author: Christine E.

description: Dinner was fairly good here as was the service. I got 4 tacos: al pastor, carnitas, carne asada, and carnitas de pato. All very good, moist, delicious meat, good amount, double corn tortilla. The jicama salad was pasable. Also got the esquite, which was alright but not made in the traditional way and definitely nothing to rave about. They put tomato and other stuff that takes from the flavor of the corn. The traditional esquite is served in a cup, with crema and Lemon. They had a pretty good wine selection and the space was very nice. I've had better Mexican food in SF, though.
author: Carolina R.

description:
Mediocre food, and the waiter brings you the check halfway through your meal. 
Don't eat here!
author: Flavia Stefani R.

description: The wife and I Indulged a bit at this place. We figured how often will we get out to this area so.. Everything about their delicious grub has been said and is definitely true (the queso fundido still haunts me) HOWEVER... I will say what put em over the top for us was the staff. Everyone was extremely friendly and welcoming. From the big smiles and friendly banter, to the ceaseless attentivness and holding doors open even, this staff knows how to treat guests and are a first class operation all the way. Check em out if you're in the area. Actually just make a trip out specifically to check em out and make a day in the city out of it. We'll be back.
author: Jesse B.

description: Excellent Mexican food - I took 2 tackos and a flan. Quantity is not huge, so don't come if you're too hungry. I will definitely come back!
author: Alex G.

description:
I can't say enough positive stuff about this restaurant. Everything from the design, to the staff, to the management is top-notch. 
We visited San Francisco last weekend and decided to stop by this place, since it was directly across the street from our hotel room. 
The owners are very kind and inviting, and the wait staff reflects the same attitude. The appetizers and entrees were stunning! 
I'd recommend it to everyone
author: Santiago M.

description: Friendly and prompt service. The food was great! Bathroom is very clean. Great atmosphere.
author: Miche B.

description: Good food. Okay service. Did not accept quarters apparently or trade dollars for quarters to pay for the meter.
author: Daniel F.

description: I probably come here more often solely due to their location on Hayes, but overall the food is still pretty solid.  I'd recommend their guacamole and chips and the fish tacos.  Both together are great for a light, post-workout meal.  The fish tacos are my favorite of the taco choices-  the more meaty options are always flavorful but meat itself tends toward dry.
author: Joanne G.

description: Apparently "carne asada" equals steak and fries cuz that's what I received. Way overpriced for what you get. $70 for two entrees, a beer, and a margarita. Nothing special in terms of taste or quality. I won't be back.
author: Aaron D.

description:
Stumbled upon this place after Happy Hour at Brass Tracks in Hayes Valley. This place is yum!!! We arrived at 7pm on a Friday, no reservation, and waited only about 15 minutes. The food here is really, really, good. Also, pretty reasonably priced for SF standards!

The enchiladas are amazing and their burrito was fantastic as well. Their portions are big on those dishes, however the tacos are pretty small. I didn't try it, but my friend ordered it and she was pretty hungry even after finishing three. 

Only reason i'm giving this place 4 stars is because of the ambiance. It's not the typical Friday night dinner spot I would pick. It's really casual and laid back. If you're looking for a "date night" spot, you probably won't like the ambiance here. But i'll definitely be back for the food!
author: Tina J.

description: I wanted to like this place because it's close to my house and is Mexican, but it really disappointed. The ingredients were fresh but it was just kind of bland. It also gets super hot and loud in the restaurant, beyond just the standard noise.
author: Stacie C.

description: Fast and clean. Sat at the counter/bar. Bartender suggested a great dish and drink combo. He was attentive and engaging.
author: Clayton C.

description: This place is a gem! Coming from the South, I had no idea there was such a thing as *Healthy Mexican food*. Everything here is fresh and yummy. Fresh shrimp, avocado, plantain, sweet potato, all kinds of deliciousness. Can't wait to go back.
author: Shu J.

description:
We live in SF and have tons of good Mexican food ... So, there is no reason why this place exists. 

The food was mostly tasteless. We had ordered the queso fundido, carne asada, steak fajita and a taco platter. Sadly, no one in the party liked their dish. Everything needed flavor!

2 stars because the ambience was nice, we got seated quickly and the waiter was decent.

Oh well.
author: Ankur V.

description: I really wish I could have given this restaurant the 4 stars I had intended too. However hours after leaving the restaurant I wound up in the Emergency Room being admitted for food poisoning. The only conclusion I can come to is the Pozole. That was the only dish in which my boyfriend and I did not share and the only item of food in which I ate. The service was great, the food was otherwise good. However the bill in which I received after for medical expenses not to mention the physical pain in which I went through was not worth it. I am not sure i will be returning to pepito for the fear of going through that bout of food poisoning again lol
author: Valerie G.

description:
From the owners of Chez Maman close by comes Papitos West. There's already a location in Potrero Hill and they've decided to open another, much like Chez Maman. 

SO glad to have a good mex restaurant in the hood. Estrellas around the corner is basically inedible. :-X

I got the fish taco and the carne asada taco. Both were really good. $9 for two tacos. Chips were also really good, but you gotta pay for em. Surprise surprise. My pal got the burrito and it unfortunately had less carne asada than my taco.
author: Josie A.

description:
I spent the afternoon wandering around Hayes street with a friend and meeting up with a Tinder date up on Market street. At this point, I'd walked ~4 miles and had been drinking teas/juices from the hottest of Asian tea stops in SF and I really, seriously needed to eat. 

From the outside, the restaurant didn't leave a huge impression. There was a small, narrow doorway with a little menu outside. However as soon as I stepped in, Silicon Valley modernism filled the view with shiny reflective glass windows, a barn-like wooden ceiling, and steely-looking furniture inside. I loved the modern, clean look it presented itself with and gladly sat myself down on the bar. 

Our waiter (wish I remembered his name) was a very friendly, heavily-accented charming man who was very patient with our indecision. In the end, I ordered the Esquite with black beans and corn. 

Food arrived in ~10 minutes. The presentation of the food was very lovely. My Esquite was in a small, shallow earthen-colored bowl. Flowers, green onions, and Cojito cheese were sprinkled on top of it. The dish itself was very homey and tasty; the corn was fresh/sweet and the beans perfectly soft (but not overcooked). The jack and cojito cheese brought all the flavors together in a salty union (I love cheese. If you don't like cheese or gooey cheesy things, I wouldn't recommend this dish). 

All in all, would come back again.
author: Vivian L.

description: After a very long travel day and a group that was starving... we stumbled across Pepito! The food was great. The guac was probably some of the best I've ever had and the salsa trio was so yummy and very different. We sat right at a table and were served quickly. Love how you can mix/match tacos and my family loved the burritos. We also got a pitcher of margaritas... they were okay, not my favorite. But the food was awesome! Just what we needed after a long day. Highly recommend it and the area of Hayes Valley.
author: Kristine P.

description: Great food and service! Loved the fish tacos and the churros with a scoop of ice cream is perfection!
author: Brunie D.

description:
The wife and I were hungry and in a rush. We stumbled upon this place and it didn't disappoint.  The host was very accommodating and knew how to conduct business intelligently and efficiently. Host took us in, attended us, served quickly, paid and we were out of there within half an hour. Restaurant got our business, we got our food and left a generous tip. Smart business move.

I had the steak quesadilla. It was messy but tasteful. Meat was cooked perfectly so that it was juicy and soft. Condiments were spot on: avocado, salsa, cilantro, onions, and sour cream to garnish it. I was quite pleased. However in other instances I would not have paid $13 for a quesadilla. This was worth it though. 

Wife had ceviche. Can't say much as I didn't eat it all but the little bit that she shared with me was quite delicious as well and enough to feed her appetite. She had a blue moon to go with it and that too was delicious. 

Ambience was a bit loud for my taste but that's up to you. We dined there at 19.00 

5 for accommodating and conducting business well
5 for service 
4 for food
3 for ambience. 
Total: 4.25 stars.
author: Jaime M.

description:
Famished and sticky from the sweltering heat on a Sunday afternoon, the mom and I decided to drop in for a late lunch/early dinner kinda thing. We were surprised to see no wait and various open tables, given that it was a holiday weekend. The place is pretty intimate and small, but not in an uncomfortable way. 

Service was quick and attentive, so five stars there. 

We started with a couple of horchatas, albondigas, and oysters-- all were delicious. I'm usually not a huge horchata fan because I typically find them too watery or sweet. However, there's was perfect. My mom said it tasted fresh and homemade-- not from some package.
Albondigas were good but very filling! They're essentially meatballs topped with cheese accompanied by some roasted brussel sprouts. YUM! Oysters were good but nothing special (though I can't remember the exact variety). 

For the main course, I ordered the Camarones Enchilads. They came served atop some rice and beans. The enchiladas are made with corn tortillas, stuffed with cheese, and finally sprinkled with about 5 jumbo shrimp. I certainly enjoyed them, but don't be thrown off by the small size of the plate. Would I get them again? Meh, I'd like to try something else. 

Mom got the Carne Asada plate. Meat was tender and they give you a side of skinny fries. Once again, good but not spectacular. 

I do have to say that this place is kinda pricey, but pretty on par with the area. I like the freshness and ambiance of this place but I would probably order something else if I was to come back again. There are other similar places on my list I would like to try first!
author: Josselin A.

description:
Too often with Mexican food, I find one has to choose between taste or ambiance. Want an amazing El Pastor taco? Go to a taco truck. Want a nice Mexican dinner with friends? Go to a cool restaurant with mediocre food. 

That's why I was pleased with how delicious and hip Papitos is. The food is delicious and really filling! I can usually split one order of the quesadillas with a friend and we're full. Tacos are always a solid option too. 

They don't take reservations which is annoying, especially considering how small the restaurant is. It helps that the restaurant is in the heart of Hayes Valley so you can walk around while waiting for your table.
author: Ashwin S.

description: Came here a few times while my parents were visiting for graduation. The food is very good, especially the carne asada entree. I also tried the quesadillas: huge portion at great price. I ordered the white sangria both times; it's delicious. The staff is professional and friendly.
author: Dodi G.

description:
Food: I got the Carnitas Tacos. They were delicious. The meat was very tender and the sauces were a beautiful combination. The portions are relatively small but I liked that because it keeps you from overeating. The food is all organic!

I went there a second time recently and the food was not as good!

Service: The waiter was very friendly and patiently explained what all the menu items were to us. Also our order came very fast.

Atmosphere: The restaurant has a huge mural on one side and is very clean with a modern design.
author: Rica Z.

description: Excellent food. We all had guacamole and shrimp quesadillas. Refined high end Mexicali flavored for a reasonable price. If you like Mexican, it's a definite to add to your rotation!
author: Heather E.

description:
Went there foe dinner and had the spicy steak fajitas.  I was really disappointed.  The meat was tough and the seasoning was much more Asian than Mexican.  What's up with that?  The refried beans were good but for what I paid for the meal they didn't cut it.
There are a zillion better places to go so I'm not returning.
author: J D.

description:
Dear Papito;

I'm writing to you as I'm walking away into the cold grey afternoon to express my feelings of heartbreak, anger, and most deplorably, hunger. 
I stopped in with my lady on my walk home to grab something tasty. I live right up the street, and I've always meant to stop in to experience what your place has to offer. 
We sat down at the bar and was greeted by a nice bartender/host. She took our order promptly and that was nice. We got our chips and guac, and ordered the Pozole and Shrimp burrito; after which point things went downhill. 
We waited.
Then we waited.
After which we waited more. 
35 minutes we sat at the bar, staring into your kitchen, during which we received no attention (save a water refill).
All the while people around us are receiving food. To-Go Orders are going out. Bummer.
I finally have to stand up and ask what's going on in the kitchen. 
"The ticket didn't print."
No kidding.
I get it, I work in the service industry too. Sometimes these things happen. I'll be disappointed but not mad. 
The reason I'm *mad* is because no body did anything to fix it. There was no offer to rush the order, there was no offer of some more guac while we wait, or a little salad to tide us over...
In fact, when we said never mind we'll just come back another time, YA'LL STILL MADE ME PAY FOR THE GUAC. c'mon. 
So we leave hungry, sad, and pretty pissed.

Sorry our first date was so bad... but you could have tried harder.
author: Josh H.

description:
Queso with chorizo is a great start. 

No joke-best dessert in Hayes! The churros have found a special place in my thighs.
author: kelsey g.

description:
Great Mexican food in Hayes valley! The place is a bit hard to spot with all the construction around and they don't have a sign unfortunately, look out for the red walls, that was how I spotted it. There was no wait thankfully and we were seated right away. 
The spot is not too big, but the seating is comfortable. I started my meal with the guac, chips and salsa. The chips tasted as if they were home made, very fresh and warm which was excellent. The guac was chunky and had some good kick to it.
I decided to go with tacos for my entree. 2 fish, one carne asada and one carnitas. The fish ones were the best by far, the slaw on top was very good as well. The carnitas one I was not too big of a fan of due to it being a bit sweet with some fruit inside of the meat. The carne asada one was good as well. I highly recommend getting the fish ones, I definitely will stick to that next time. Overall a very cool spot with some good authentic Mexican food.
author: Josue V.

description: Excellent experience every time I stop by, the food is always fresh and delicious, nice Mexican taste with an organic signature! But the best of all is the hostess!! Super friendly, always smiling and the best example of a Mexican beauty. Ceviche papitos is my favorite one even better than Mexico.
author: Guillermo O.

description: Enjoyable. accommodating. pleasant.  bright. airy. good atmosphere. if you like your food hot (temperature), ask when you order.
author: Laura f.

description: Food was solid, super burritos were massive! Ask for the habanero sauce if you're feeling spicy. Manager comped us for one of our burritos after a mix up with our order.
author: Natalie V.

description: The food and drinks seem average to me. The service has always been friendly, but the dishes I order never seem to have that extra pop of flavor that I am looking for that would merit a 4 or 5-star rating. I've had the burrito multiple times, and although it is fairly large, it lacks in flavor. I have also had the chicken torta which was decent... but, again, nothing amazing. It did come with a side of yummy fries, though. I've also ordered a few of their margaritas and it looked as if they were pre-mixed and not made fresh to order, so that was disappointing. The ambiance is nice, so enjoy the atmosphere and the decent Mexican food, but do not come here expecting fireworks.
author: John L.

description:
Organic Mexican in a bright bustling space.  First things I noticed at lunch time: Big guys eating burritos with their hands where the tortilla was pan-toasted, yum.  Friends at the bar drinking blood orange margaritas and sharing four dishes at once, yum.

The menu categories are common: burritos, salads, soups, quesadillas, enchiladas, tacos, tortas, raw, etc, but within each there are several mouth-watering options. You know you've got it good when there are 10 types of quesadillas, 10 types of tacos (I got tempura shrimp w/ chipotle remoulade and purple cabbage slaw, and the vegetarian corn, cauliflower, peppers, mushrooms, "orange oaxaca sauce"), and a gazillion other choices:
http://papitosf.com/papito_west/west_menu.html

Prices are pretty high for Mexican (~$15-30/pp minimum), but then most Mexican places don't have the same quality of ingredients and atmosphere.  Portions are sometimes small (tacos), or sometimes massive (pozole soup whoa 4 cups of richness).
author: Melanie C.

description: Went back with a larger group, sat on the patio and enjoyed burritos, chips, salsa, guacamole, and the sangria. Great service too.
author: D F.

description:
Good food, lovely staff.

Seems to be busy so you need to be prepared to put your name down and wait 10 mins though.
author: Lee B.

description: V v thankful this place is delicious because it's the only Mexican food close to my apartment. Definitely a bit pricey (see: quesadillas), but it's always fresh and tasty. Good service and great margaritas. For some reason it was so hard finding places that had pitchers of margaritas on Cinco de Mayo so again Papito came through clutch with them.
author: Shawn T.

description: Dropped in here with a couple friends to grab a bite to eat, and man was it a good choice! Together we ordered a blood orange margarita pitcher, fries with aoili, salsa trio, tacos, and ceviche. Thanks to my fellow yelpers, I had to order the blood orange marg- and it was delish! It tastes like a tart, fresh squeezed orange topped with a unique salt/sugar/paprika around the glass! I also loved the ceviche- it tasted incredibly fresh and contained big hunks of shrimp, avocado, and grilled pineapple! Our server was the perfect balance of attentive but not obnoxious and very friendly :) I'll definitely be back soon!
author: Nicole W.

description: My husband and I live a few blocks away and we decided to try this place out for brunch.  I only wish we had come here sooner!  Our omelets (I ordered the shrimp and he ordered the chorizo) came out quickly and were incredibly tasty.  I always eat my omelets with ketchup and can honestly say this one did not need any because there were so many bursts of flavor.  The fruit cup was also delicious (very fresh ingredients, nicely chilled and even had pomegranate).  Overall, I loved the variety on the menu and the quality of our meal and am looking forward to trying out lunch or dinner sometime soon!
author: Stella C.

description: Favorite Mexican in SF! The mole enchilada is excellent! Good value as well. This place is smaller and gets busy!
author: Emily H.

description: The place is clean so that's good. I ordered a carneasada quesadilla and the waitress brought me a wrong order. She didn't apologize and put me in a uncomfortable position of choosing to take the order back and having food be wasted cuz it had the wrong meat. Like woman, you should've made sure it was the right order in the first place. And at least apologized or did something like give a discount. This place is pretentious and not authentic Mexican. If you're looking to eat real Mexican food in the city please head to the mission district. That's what we should have done.
author: Jo Z.

description: Today was my first time coming here. I had the fried chicken tacos. I loved them they are the bomb. I ordered chips  that came with three different kinds of salsa. I will definitely come here again. Luis was an excellent server. Yummy!
author: Kiana D.

description:
Stopped by this restaurant for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  I'd really like to give this place 4 stars because the food is pretty good but I just didn't have a great dining experience.  This particular weekend the weather was extremely hot in San Francisco, and the water they served was lukewarm and not refreshing at all.  Is it so much to ask for a restaurant to serve cold water, especially on a hot day?  The other bad part was that it was really hot inside the restaurant, I think because the kitchen is right near the seating area so the heat spreads very easily. They also had these lamps along the wall that were radiating heat like little heat lamps.  Due to the combination of all of these things, I was literally sweating throughout the entire meal which made it very difficult to enjoy the food and dining atmosphere.

But at least the food was pretty good and our waitress was nice!  I was a little bit peeved to see that you had to pay for chips and salsa -- welcome to SF I guess.  The chips came with three tasty salsas which were all very unique.  We also ordered shrimp ceviche and the "mixto" seviche, which were both superb (probably the best part of our meal!).  The mixto seviche in particular was really good, with its mix of octopus, shrimp, and fish.  I ordered a burrito mojado with skirt steak and frankly wasn't very impressed. My friend ordered the 4 taco combo which looked a whole lot better, and I'd definitely order that if I were to come back.  

I feel that had the weather been a bit cooler I would have had a much better dining experience, but three stars is all I can give.
author: David B.

description: We come for dinner whenever we have tickets to Davies Symphony Hall.  The food is California / Mexican and it's fresh ingredients accentuate every meal that is cooked to perfection even the most difficult fish that can make any Chef a short order cook.  All you need to do is look at the staff everyone is happy to be there and smiling, having fun. Parking is not too difficult, Seating is inside or outside or at the bar and late comers will wait, oh yeah, and wait but they stay the wait because the food on the entire menu is that Goooood....
author: JACK W.

description:
West is best.

Didn't have many stars for the original Potrero location: http://www.yelp.com/biz/papito-san-francisco?hrid=uGDs2bnk3IAfce0b4wkO2Q

Almost giving five for the new Hayes Valley location: An exceptional shrimp, bell pepper and tomato omelette paired with a potent three shot Americano will do that.

Food is only part of the story. Our extremely friendly server requested on my behalf egg whites (got them) and agreed to swap salad for potatoes. Two awesome moves.

About the only thing not enjoyable was the sun streaming through the ceiling window. Got to be a bit uncomfortable towards the end in an otherwise relaxed space.

Spent about $15/person which is on the high end for brunch but here felt you absolutely get what you pay for.

Tortas and churros are still on the list to try. Perhaps it's time to give the original another shot.
author: Jason B.

description: Food & service were good. Unfortunately 2 of 3 of us were pretty sick the next morning. I won't be going back
author: Joel M.

description:
Delicious! Happy vegetarian in Papitos.

I ordered esquites, they were yummy!, they have a really good sauce, also ordered a vegetarian queso fundido  it has great rajas (green chili) and for dessert, churros, mmmm great also!
author: Paola L.

description:
Welcome surprise. We managed to get in before the crowd came in after participating in the annual Bay to Breakers footrace. Restaurant was the path of the race.

Service staff great, pleasant surroundings, food was good but needed more punch to the dishes, not as seasoned as I had hoped. The "original chorizo omellette" was not as inspiring as I thought or imagined it to be. 

Check it out and let me know if I didn't get it right.
author: Edgar M.

description: I live around the corner and was always tempted by this place. Always seemed busy and fun. The food menu was interesting..... It seemed like they tried too hard to make it upscale-y.... They failed. The food was ehhhhh, the service made up for it though.The Margaritas however, EXCELLENT.... I had a pitcher to myself...... By the end of the pitcher the food was manageable.  Wouldn't be back here for more than Margs and Chips though.....
author: Alan M.

description:
Papito West is another refreshing addition to Hayes Valley, my favorite and closest go-to neighborhood for dining. We wanted to try this place and decided to make it a Sunday brunch spot...minus the booze. The location is prime and we went on an awesome day with outdoor seating. To our liking, a table of studs was sitting out front and totally checking us out. We were already off to a good start.
I had the fried chicken bendict, a speciality there from what our waitress told us! I was down to splurge so this was a good way to go. I thought it would be overwhelmingly heavy but it wasn't at all! The sauce had a jalepeno flavor and wasn't heavy like hollandaise, the fried chicken was not overpowering or heavy and cooked to crisp perfection. Totally delicious! My friend had the veggie breakfast burrito and loved it. 
The chips and salsa are also a must The salsas are flavorful and authentic. 
I'm a fan and want to go back to try more of their dinner menu!
author: Priya S.

description: To be honest, entirely unimpressed. To begin with, I ordered enchiladas with carnitas, and the dish arrived barely lukewarm, despite the server's admonition not to touch the (stone cold) earthenware bowl. Clearly, everything had come directly from a warming pan and not even been reheated. The general impression was "sub-Chipotle." Secondly, the margaritas are incredibly watery. If you read the fine print of the menu, it does note that the margaritas are made with a "double-shot" or 20% agave, though, if you do the math, a double-shot at 20% equals only one miserly shot of normal tequila, utterly lost in ice and mixer. Their "blood orange" margarita tasted for all the world like completely non-alcoholic Hawaiian Punch. Would not return.
author: John A.

description: I can't believe this got such good reviews. Sitting here with my friend now and reminiscing about our meal last night--both the roast chicken and the steak fajitas were actively bad--bland and unsatisfying. We both agreed this was some of the worst Mexican we'd had in SF. But it was full on a Thursday, so some people seem to like it. Service was nice and polite. But they really need to step up their food game. Even the salsa was meh.
author: Jared S.

description: I love this place! I've been to Papito a few times and it has always been delicious! The chicken Quesadillas are amazing and I can't stop eating their guacamole! I can't wait to go back!
author: Rocky Z.

description: I've been wanting to try this place for awhile and I'm glad I finally did!  I had the asada enchiladas and my friend had the grilled chicken entree - both were delicious!  We shared a bottle of pinot noir.  I thought the prices were actually reasonable considering the portion sizes and quality of food.  Atmosphere is great, too!  I'll be back!
author: Elise C.

description:
I go here to pick up food pretty frequently since I work just down the street. Most of everything I've gotten from here is really great and fresh tasting. I would only say that the salsa you get with your chips are a little underwhelming.

So far my only real complaint is they keep putting sour cream in my burritos when I keep asking to have them leave it out. Which is a bummer because without the sour cream the burrito is great. It just seems like they're ignoring this simple request half the time.
author: Angus M.

description:
What an epic let down.

I got the 2 tacos for $9 (already pricy but I can justify it if they are good)

I ordered the "el vegetariano" tacos which were supposed to have crispy tofu, wild mushrooms, poblano peppers rajas, corn & salsa verde (skipped the cheese to make it vegan) but it was so lousy I could barely eat it.

The tofu was not crispy, not seasoned or even marinated at all.

Look, I get that restaurants sell more meats and seafoods and non-vegan items but if you're going to offer a veggie option at least give it half the attention meat items would get.

The tacos were cold by the time I got them and the unmarinated tofu, unseasoned mushrooms and corn.

On the plus side, salsa was good, service was great!

Probably just not a good place for vegans and vegetarians.

Won't return.
author: MJ S.

description: The service was good and the food came out very fast. I ordered a super burrito with carnitas and I would definitely get it again. The appetizers were great and the ambience is also nice.
author: Eva D.

description:
Que Lastima!

Bland "Mexican" food + High prices = Sad face.  Tiny tears...

These folks are SO very nice, the service crisp and the environment clean and vibrant with a colorful back wall mural.

I try to give new spots at least 3 chances, over a period of no less than 3 months, to allow for any un-kinking.  I think that's fair.  But my second visit was such a disappointment I can't bear throwing good money away again.

And here's the mystery - Why?!   Seemingly they've got all the right parts but the whole just doesn't fly, there's no 'there' there, no flavor, no sabor.  BLAND.  Flavorless. Both times our chips have been stale and the salsa trio is cute but form over function.

Too bad.  HV needs a good Taqueria muy rapido.  Unfortunately, this isn't it.

Triste in Hayes Valley.
author: Casey H.

description: I crave the super shrimp burrito and veggie enchiladas here! The ingredients are super fresh and each dish comes out just right every time. They don't take reservations, but I was able to get a group of six in at 6 pm on a Sunday. They were quite accommodating, although it's definitely not the type of place you can linger at. It's so popular that I felt a bit of pressure to quickly order, eat, and get outta there so they could turn our table over.
author: Andrea C.

description:
My second visit was still a great experience. Food was still very good and service was better.

Had to have the ceviche again. If you can find anything negative to say about it you suck. I could eat it every day for the rest of my life. Fo real.

We got 4 tacos again but made a point to get a different 4 than last time. All were good and still had different toppings/condiments. 

GF had the eggs Benedict with fried chicken. She said it wasn't as good as her eggs Guadalajara on the previous visit but still good.

I got the pastor quesadilla. Very good. It had pineapple salsa and lots of cheese. It was just done right. 

Service was more on top of things than last visit. Still were friendly and helpful. Food came out at a great pace.

We were looking for a different spot to have Sunday lunch but after walking around Hayes Valley we decided to come back here because we know the food was good and fast. 

Ceviche, 4 tacos, quesidlla, eggs Benedict and a coffee were $60 before tip. Considering everything, that seems totally reasonable.
author: Dash_Rendar _.

description: Great Mexican food! Great ceviche, quesadillas and enchiladas! Decor is clean and ambiance is modern. They have a good selection of drinks including some very decent sangrias. I came here twice already and I'll probably come back again!
author: Cedric L.

description: This place is incredible!! There's something magical going on with the salsa, and grilled shrimp couldn't have tasted more fresh. Get the Tempranillo
author: Emily M.

description: Clean, cozy, and well-staffed. The tacos are all I have tried so far, but they have brought me back time and time again. I recommend Papito Hayes to all of my friends looking for delicious Mexican cuisine without the dirty hole-in-the-wall ambiance of many taquerias.
author: Kaili K.

description:
We came for the queso but sadly it was not on the brunch menu! Sad! We stayed for the tacos and huevos though and were not disappointed.

It was a bit busy on a Saturday around noon but not too bad given the area. I loved the decor and the huge painting at the far end of the room. 

I definitely think we'll be back since I haven't had queso in over 6 years and would love to try theirs.
author: Cassandra J.

description: BEST Mexican food this side of the legal border.  I feel so illegal eating here.  The food is amazingly authentic with an organic spin.  Wish I could live in this restaurant.
author: Edward V.

description: There is really nothing special about this place. My Margarita was poured out of pitcher. Really?? The gauc was average. Tacos were just ok. The whole experience felt impersonal and assembly line like. Meh -- I will not be back.
author: Max S.

description: This place has amazing staff and even better guac. It feels cozy and homey, and we have yet to have a bad meal after multiple visits to this neighborhood spot.
author: Kristie F.

description: great vibe. they have oysters in a Mexican restaurant so we tried. ALL of them are fresh&clean! we also tried all 10 tacos on the menu. EACH OF THEM ARE SO WORTH TRYING! personally i love duck confit & veggie the most!
author: Yujie Y.

description: Prompt attentive staff. Blood orange margarita was delicious and the Carnitas Enchiladas had a great mix of flavors and was so filling. Definitely enjoyed my visit. If you have a picky child, maybe don't get the chicken and fries. Fries were fine but the chicken was pretty dry and bland. Don't judge the restaurant by that though. I wouldn't really consider this a family restaurant. Great for a date or out with friends though.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Good organic food. Service is good too. I like it and would commend it to
 my friends.
author: Tatiana T.

description:
I ordered one shrimps salad with extra avocado.

It's too..I mean toooo toooo much salty,could even eat.Shrimp was okay,avocado was just top of salad.So I just had shrimp and avocado.

It wasn't that bad before but I want them to have consistent taste of the foods what they served.

Price wasn't even cheap.I paid 18 dollars for this salty couldn't even eat salad.
author: Katelyn L.

description: Everything I've tried at Papito (over the course of 50+ visits) has been awesome. The pozole is, by far, the best I've ever had, and I get it at least 1-2 times a week. Went on a culinary tour of Mexico City looking for a better pozole and couldn't find one!!
author: Alexandra P.

description: Solid Mexican food. The super burrito was full of fresh ingredients, not just rice. Guac on point too.
author: Katie B.

description: The shrimp salad was horrible, all frisse, 2 slices of tomato and mango both mushy, some sort of green bean or mushy green peppers in it.  The shrimp on skewer was the only saving part, but the salad was worst ever, do not recommend it.
author: Stevon S.

description:
Well, our server took our appetizer order and never came back. Then we watched her do all of her sidework until we flagged down the bartender after 15 min. We had to wait so long that we got our entrees Togo... And even when our entrees came in the bag, she still didn't come back with our check until we flagged her down again. I also watched the host put her fingers in some food and eat it before boxing it Togo on the food line. Fire your staff. The service is killing the restaurant. 

The food however was excellent and we tipped above 20%. Hopefully our terrible server and your staff will learn something.


Update: The manager seems to have corrected all of what went on that night. Thankfully.
author: Jaymee S.

description:
I grew up in Southern California but moved to the East Coast, so I've been separated from good Mexican food. I've been on a taco binge for the past month and let me tell you, the tacos at this place are AWESOME. It's important to note that these are on the fancier side of tacos. They're not crazy fusion korean tacos, but they're not traditional hole-in-the-wall either. The ingredients are much higher quality (I think most of their items are organic) and they spend more time preparing them.

We got the chips and salsa, which came with a sampler of 3 salsas. I thought one of them was pretty good, the others were OK.

For the meal, we shared 4 tacos. This is where amazing things happened. We got:
--Carnitas: didn't care for the sauce on this one as much. it was a little spicy and tasted similar to barbecue sauce.
--Pastor: my all-time favorite. the pineapple was a great touch and the marination on the meat was incredible.
--Shrimp: the sauce was really great. only downside was that there were only 2 shrimp.
--Carne asada: super savory, great sauce.

I also have to note that their corn tortillas were really soft and delicious.

All in all, a restaurant with a hip vibe and a few killer tacos.
author: Marissa G.

description:
This place never disappoints!!!

Everything on the menu is amazing. Servers are friendly and attentive. This is without a doubt my go-to in the neighborhood.
author: Eleanor P.

description:
8/26/14 -
as stated previously, i WILL go back again - matter of fact ill be trying it out again within a few days and will happily YELP my findings.  THIS one's really important to me since i was so taken with them when they 1st opened...scrool down for my 1st reviews...LOVED them, lusted after the food...

then, i hit a very bad spell with them (below).  REALITY tho, is that every newly opened restaurant will have some glitches and ups and downs, i just had a few down moments in a row.

i CAN almost guarantee tho, that IF i had eaten IN the restaurant, instead of doing take out so much, the bad food i encountered would have been swapped out for something else.  joys of eating at home - FULL BAR!  

i sincerely hope my next time restores my faith in them...in spite of my last few experiences - god i miss them!


7/1/14 -
URP! what the heck has happened to this place in the last week or so?  new cook? or LACK thereof...
its about a week or so i havent eaten here and after "lusting" for a meal from here all day long...
well, time to break out the peanut butter and jelly...just so i have a decent meal tonite after eating here.

i ordered the same as my very first meal from here - the steak fajitas.  first time, it was tasty but an off cut of meat i wasnt used to in fajitas...
TONITE, well the rubbery, tough - inedible - excuse for meat and the rest is sitting in the trash.  it was truly like TRYING to eat an old tire.  if i had never eaten from here before...
and THIS was my 1st meal?
i'd share it on yelp and never go back.

as it is - i wont go back.  im happy to spend more money on a meal than most, you get what you pay for, but dont expect people to pay for quality - and deliver crap.  sadly, i'd experienced a bit of quality decline the last few times (just little things) but NOTHING like the crappy inedible fajitas on 7/1.  someone needs to fire that cook...

OLD reviews ----------------
im not sure what the "foodie" equivalent of post-coital bliss is, but thats where im writing from right now.

ive just had my 3rd meal from papito west in the last week.  im NOT one of those uber-rich google kids LOL, just a guy who's lived in HV for decades.  ive seen my 'hood go thru many BAD changes but THIS places isnt one!

the food is amazing! some of the closest ive had to the many meals i enjoyed when living in jalisco, mexico - fresh, prepared with love and caring.

1st time out - fajitas.  i had the steak.  great flavor and juicy!  great black beans and rice included.  i was full! AND i can throw down some food.  my ONLY negative thing was, since i ordered TOGO, the plate soaked up some of the juices...sad only because its so darned TASTY!  a remedy follows tho* ...

2nd time - i had a burrito.  that lowly meal that is NOT mexican but many gringos (gavachos)  think it is.  another amazing meal.  i ordered it with carnitas, my fave, and i was NOT disappointed.  it was full and fresh, and no "weird" wet or dry spots like most places.  am i raving too much?  lol i PROMISE i dont work there.  once again, FULL after my meal.  and yes, i know this is slightly higher than regular "burrito" places, but isnt really great food worth another 2 bucks or so???

tonite i had the emmolada.  its kinda cold in the city tonite and i needed the comfort of a good mole.  WOW!  the pickled onions on top were a crunchy sweet/sour treat to my mouth.  both beans and rice were tasty and comforting as i watch the fog roll past my windows...the chicken was mouthwatering.
* the CURE for us TOGO people is to simply ask them to line the bottom of the TOGO plate with foil, that keeps the juices in.  once again, tho i didnt eat all the chips that come with it,  i am FULL!  full like a holiday meal full.  i need a nap now.

so PLEASE, do yourselves a favor and visit them!  if you know good "true' mexican food, you will love what they do here...

i plan on eating IN the restaurant soon, ive had an injury which has made that difficult, BUT ill follow up once im in the place.  love the art and "feel" of the place also.  

im one of the old timers VERY skeptical of the glut of "trendy" restaurants opening up due to their snooty upscale, e-xxx-pensive small portioned dreck.  i eat food - NOT hipster ambiance.  THIS place is a MUST for anyone reading this - seriously.
author: Miguel D.

description:
This review is based solely on tacos. The place was packed, which I took to be a good sign - people in San Francisco should know good Mexican food from mediocre, right? I got the 4 tacos for $15 "deal." At that price, they should be really good tacos, no?

I got carnitas, duck confit carnitas, al pastor, and potato with chorizo. All the meats were dry and bland. It was apparent that both the pork and duck versions of carnitas had been cooked in some sort of water based liquid. Even with the promising word confit in the description of one of them! Major carnitas amateur move. Even the house made chorizo was bland - sorry, the fact that you made it does not automatically make it good. The condiments on the tacos were fairly tasty, but that's all I tasted. The dry bland meats underneath were completely overpowered by the bountiful piles of roasted pineapple, pickles, salsas, herbs, chipotle tamarind sauce, etc. (you get the idea).

In summary, if your main criteria for a taqueria are cool music and an innovative pickle program, this might be your place. If they're delicious tacos and reasonable prices, there are several hundred places in the Bay Area where you will have better luck.
author: Jon A.

description: We have been going to this place for sometime and really like it. It seems like they have a very nice staff, the food and drinks are great also. I have to say though a couple of times the dishes we ordered were inconsistent. For example, when I first had their fajitas, the chicken was excellent: fresh, spicy. But when I recently ordered the same the chicken was not good. Some pieces were ok, but some did not taste right- crunchy or something was wrong with it. I still would recommend this restaurant to anyone but hope that the management would make some improvements.
author: Sophie N.

description: Don't let the full restuarant stop you from throwing your name on the list.  As soon as we wrote our names down we were greeted by the hostess that seated us.  I thought the service was really great including Raul who helped me select a wine.  He was so patient while I tried different types of white until I found the one I wanted to drink.  The food was really good and reasonably priced for the quality and the neighborhood.  I would definitely go back and soon.
author: Kirsten M.

description: I'd avoided this place because the menu seemed overpriced, but went with the husband and his work colleagues. We all had delicious meals and I left feeling like it was a value. They use fish sauce to season the steak for the fajitas and they buy organic corn tortillas from La Palma, and every single bite was delicious. I will definitely come back. Also: the manager was super helpful in answering a bunch of my tables questions. He was friendly about taking a group pic and before we sat down was even willing to call us in the cell so we could walk around Hayes valley while waiting for our table of 8.
author: matthew d.

description: Located in a really cute area, surrounded by all different types of restaurants, is this little Mexican restaurant.  The place was so busy and really hard to get any service.  Now slow (not horrid) service can get a little annoying, but on top of that, the food was not even good.  I ordered the vegetable cheese dip, which was pretty okay.  So I was really looking forward to dinner.  The first bite, I was just so sad.  The enchilada verde was so sour that I could not even eat more then two bites.  I have had plenty of enchiladas before, nothing like this.  Not being dramatic, but I really felt like every bite had a lemon wedge squeezed on it.  I have this horrible meal sitting in front of me + slow service = never again.  By the time they came around to check on us, the rest of the party was done eating, and I had no appetite (which is rare).  I did give them 3/5 stars though, because their blood orange margarita and cheese dip was decent.  Will prob never go back, once is enough.  Enjoy!!
author: Mijung H.

description: So clean inside, the service is excellent, the veggie tacos are great.  Thank you!
author: Meaghan H.

description: I can't believe this place is rated as it is it is amazing! Fajitas were way too good. It is pricey but not overpriced compared to other spots in the neighborhood and considering how good the food is.
author: Jenny M.

description:
Walked in around 8 PM on a random Monday night which is probably why they were relatively slow. We were seated right away.

We got the salsa sampler, soup as appetizers. My bf loved the mango salsa since it was sweet with a kick of spiciness at the end. The California Chili was ok but the Green sauce was my favorite. The soup came with sides of Oregano, chili powder, land lime. The server warned us on how the chili powder is a creeper. We added the chili powder slowly, after 3 spoonfuls of the chili powder, we understood what the server was talking about. It was def. a creeper with a kick at the end. 

For our entree, we shared the carne asada enchiladas and a side order of brussel sprouts. The brussel sprouts were amazing. each order of enchiladas comes with 4 enchiladas. if you're thinking only 4, these enchiladas are STUFFED and delicious. 

minus one star since they handed us the bill without asking us if we wanted dessert. We didn't finish our meal because we read about the Churros and wanted to save room for it. Not sure if they were trying to rush us out or just had a misunderstanding since we had to pack some of our dinner to go.
author: Eve W.

description: Papito has the nicest staff I've ever met! And their quesadillas are delicious. All around such a wonderful place. I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Margot Y.

description: This is the best quesadilla I've ever had before. Plus this store has the friendliest employees I've ever met.
author: Johnny L.

description:
Was scrambling to find a late lunch spot (around 4pm), since I had flown in to San Francisco mid-afternoon.  Was not aware that so many restaurants in the area are closed from 3 - 5pm.  Strike one against San Francisco's food scene!

This place was ok, but not particularly a standout.  Ate their chicken salad which was pretty good, and a side order of brussels sprouts which also were fine.  Maybe I'm not the best judge of this place's Mexican authenticity, but the food and ambience were fine.
author: Arthur A.

description:
I came in here around noon on a Saturday and the place had a good amount of people although it is relatively small. The service was incredible, the place was very chic, and everything about the restaurant felt very welcoming.

My friend and I ordered the salsa trio w/ chips as an appetizer. It came with three levels of spicyness with basically an unlimited amount of chips since they kept refilling our basket. It was very delicious but I was disappointed that there was not a mild option. The chips were a bit hard, not bad, but could have been crunchier. 

For our entree we had fried chicken tacos and the chorizo tacos. Both were delicious and theres nothing negative I can say about them.

The only reason this place is 4 stars despite the quality of its food and appearance is because you can find equally delicious mexican food in a tacqueria although i did appreciate the "organic" style.
author: Larissa Q.

description: Delicious tacos, fantastic guacamole, and wonderful service. Sadly liquor license hasn't been procured yet, but I'll be happy to revisit (with or without one)!
author: Brandy S.

description:
Have been to Papito West four or five times now. I wasn't sure what to expect from an upscale Mexican restaurant in Hayes Valley the first time I went, but this place really blew me away. 

The guac is seriously perfect, and you have got to try a blood orange margarita - you won't be disappointed!

The vegetarian tacos are noms (SO GOOD!) and the last time we were there, our waiter had us try a spicy watermelon salad which was incredible. 

The churros for desert were warm and crispy, with just the right amount of chocolate dipping sauce.

The servers are warm, friendly, and attentive, without being all up in your business, which I appreciate.

This place is just great. Love it. Now I just need to make it there for brunch!! Can't wait.
author: Annie B.

description: What a lovely surprise in Hayes Valley.  Delicious Mexican food, a tremendous selection of tacos include duck confit and carne asado, and the surprise:  an oyster bar with fabulous fresh oysters on the half shell.  Attentive service and fun decor.  Highly recommended.
author: Karen C.

description: Pozole Rojo was amazing, spicey, but delicious. Ask for crema on the side. gigantic portion and so delicious, I would come back, but I live in NY
author: Ivy A.

description: Ceviche was pretty amazing! They also make margaritas that are NOT watered down! As others have said, great place to eat! Why not 5 stars? They don't take AX, which is really unusual for an established SF eatery. That and the fact that they rushed us through while we were enjoying a leisurely visit on a Saturday afternoon in the sunshine. A bit disappointing although there was a line waiting to be seated outside.
author: H D.

description:
A refreshing perspective on hearty Mexican food. Ceviche, tacos and quesadilla with fried chicken and/or duck is the absolute winner. 

Guacamole was not fantastic but the trail after that was amazing. So, spare yourselves from the chips and guacamole and wait for entrees.
author: Ammar J.

description:
Much cozier than their location in Portrero Hill. 

The mural on the back wall, light fixtures, and furnishing are coherent and nicely balanced without being over-done.  I would've liked it to be a bit dimmer not only for the more intimate atmosphere but also so that no one could see the budding zit on my forehead!  There of course was a waiting list on a Saturday night but we were bumped up because my dear sir was a much loved frequent diner at all of the owner's establishments.  We ordered a drink at the bar while waiting and immediately a server brought us complimentary chips and salsa to snack on.  We then were sat promptly - more drinks ordered; dinner (appetizer, salad, tacos) brought to us in timely order; more drinks; desserts; complimentary cocktails (spicy something) from the owner then followed lastly by food/drink coma....  

So, finally managed to get up to head home and by which point our server was standing by to shake our hands and graciously bid us good night.  What a royal treatment it had been!  It was perfect from the moment we walked in till the minute out the door.  I'm glad to see this place is doing well and hope it will continue to be so.
author: J L.

description: Great little dive with a funky vibe. Clean and fresh with a friendly and attentive wait staff. Can't beat the location. However, the food lacks. My carne asada was chewy but not tasty for all the tangy sauce in which it was swimming. The blood orange margarita was weak and underwhelming. For tourists it might be OK but since we live in an area so heavily populated with the real deal, authentic Mexican food is easy to find. Tommy's Mexican Kitchen on Geary is still the one to beat for taste. This place is the one to beat for atmosphere and location. Nice try guys. I can see you'll keep 'em coming but for those of us who live here, nah.
author: Susan F.

description: Got a steak burrito which I thought was a little overpriced. Then the guy brings it out and it was - H U G E - and very tasty.  Probably big enough for two people but I love a good burrito and was hungry. Still not a place I'd visit just for a burrito but might go back to check out other items on their menu.
author: R S.

description:
I went to this restaurant on December 21st, with a few friends, every place we went to could not take us, so we ended up here. 

My experience was exceptional, food was really good, and the best part of our dinner was Pablo! He was wonderful, attentive, and I would go back simply to have him wait my table again.

Pablo, thank you for the wonderful service for myself and my friends!
author: Kim G.

description: Glorious Fried Chicken Burrito- get it drowned with the melted cheese and green sauce- crave-able. Amazing guac. Fresh oysters. Great wine margaritas!
author: Yvonne R.

description: Loved that they have organic ingredients. Unfortunately there is something lacking and very repetitive in the flavors. I feel they are all so similar that I've tried this place 3 times and I just can't get any fresh flavors- it all tastes the same to me. I can't explain it but with the ingredients they use, this would normally be a place I could go to again and again but I just can't bring myself to go there again. Want Mexican food, skip this and go to  the Mission.
author: Piper W.

description: tasty mexican food, great service. Margaritas are delicious. They don't take reservations and it gets busy, but service is fast and friendly.
author: Roberto S.

description: Having just returned from Mexico City, I have to say Papito felt very much, in the best sense, like restaurants we enjoyed there. I ordered the vegetarian tacos, guacamole and brussels sprouts--all excellent. The flan is truly amazing. All the wait staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. Our waiter was a bit late bringing our drinks, but cheerfully informed us they were on the house. We hadn't complained, and this just made me love the place all the more -- this too reminded me of the warmth and level of service we experienced in Mexico.
author: Bill M.

description:
We walked around Hayes Valley at 6 p.m. before an evening at the S.F. Symphony. We saw Papito and went in. What a treat! The service was excellent, the welcome warm and friendly. And the food was great! Next time I have to order the blood orange margarita that a couple at the next table had ordered. Looked so good. On the other side the couple ordered churros for dessert. Looked great too.

My shrimp quesadilla was delicious and I ordered a salad of different fruits and vegetables with orange slices...can't recall the name but it was terrific but not for the faint palate!

Very lovely experience and I honestly could have imagined myself in London or Paris. The place is small but has such an international feel to it.

Diana
author: Diana C.

description: The blood orange margaritas were superb & the tacos were absolutely amazing and worth the price. Small place with a nice staff, I have no idea how it has below 4 stars.
author: Ashley W.

description:
Having lived in San Diego for many years, it is nice to find a Mexican restaurant that knows how to cook good food. I love the baked burrito with shrimp, I love the baked burrito with beef, and I love the baked burrito with chicken. Yes I have eaten at this place a lot. There is more to the menu besides the burritos.  The menu has a great selection and some fun ideas off the beaten path traditional Mexican food that is great to try out. The location is great and the staff is so nice, and not just because I have eaten there there a lot. 

The only reason that I did not give this place 5 stars is because for some odd reason the booths are uncomfortable. The backs are almost at an 80 degree angle and the seats are too close to the tables. I am not a big person but I have friends that are. They were a little uncomfortable and still had a great time. The one thing that always bothers me about most places is that they consistently forget about the bathrooms. Paint the walls and carry the theme of the restaurant in . Nobody wants to see dirty Home Depot fixtures and dirty walls. Get creative and paint them. It can leave a bad impression on the place as a whole. 

My pet peeves aside. Love this place. Just don't sit in the booths.
author: JJ T.

description: Great service, great food! Went on a Sunday around 2. It just doesn't seem as accommodating to larger parties. But it's perfect for a date or small group. :)
author: Danielle K.

description: Every time I go to this restaurant I get amazing service. the food is good and the place is very cool looking. A must if you like " fancy " Mexican food
author: Portillo A.

description: Yyayy! I love this place! The food is elevated Mexican food with a fabulous twist! Everything I've tried I've loved & I think you will enjoy this place as I do too!!
author: Cori M.

description: Love this place. Food is awesome and staff is so great. I'm partial to the burrito, but everything is always tasty. Tables are a bit close and you can't really linger since there are plenty of people waiting, but perfect spot for a quick bite.
author: Barbara R.

description:
Yuck!
There is nothing i hate more than to over pay for Mexican food.
First off, i think our service person was Brazilian, the place is not even owned by Mexicans.
The food is over priced, not very good. The portions are small and they lack taste.
Are they in trendy Hayes Valley??? Yes, are they good??? NO...
As most restaurants in Hayes Valley, they are wayyyyy overpriced and offer very little value for what they offer..... 
People really need to wake up, the fact that they offer expensive dishes does not mean it's good food, and it's not good value for your money.
We had ceviche, frankly Costco has a package ceviche for 8 bucks that was better than the one here, and it was more than the small serving we had here.
A burrito is over 12 bucks??????
Come on!!!! There is no excuse for this, you are giving me 4 bucks worth of product and want to charged me 12 bucks...????
No way!!!!
I would much rather walk to the Mission and go to a real Mexican joint than to come back here, too bad, there are no more affordable Mexican places in Hayes Valley and now we had to deal, with this "trendy" crappy places......
I really miss the sandwich shop that was here before.....
I
author: Jose A. P.

description:
Definitely better Mexican fare out there. But in Hayes Valley, this is the only place to curb your craving for chips and salsa. 

Chips aren't free, the guacamole is just ok (needed that kick; more cilantro) and the queso fundido needed more queso. I ordered the fundido with chorizo and it needed a tad bit of salt and more cheese, as they only covered the top with cheese and the chips weren't dip-able (like you'd get at Mamacita's). 

Didn't try the tacos this round but had the ceviche and oysters. (I was really just in the mood for chips and cheese :) ). It was fresh and the sauces that accompanied the oysters were good. 

Came for lunch and it wasn't too busy. Service was fantastic.
author: Joy A.

description: I just went to papito's two days ago for the second time. I gotta say I love this place! The people that work there are very nice, their food is excellent, and I love the restaurant's decorations. Ooh yeah, and my two favorite dishes are the meatballs! their quiet spicy but delicious! And the ceviche papito! I'll definitely be back! You should try it too!
author: Berlin M.

description:
Great food! Cozy little atmosphere.  
The owner gave us an excellent service! 
I will definitely go back. ^^
author: Ganzees K.

description:
Great Mexican Food!

They have the best tacos in the city. My favorite are the Papito (Tempura Shrimp) and Fried Chicken.  I usually prefer my Mexican fix in authentic hole in the walls like El Farolito and La Taqueria, but this place is the best in terms of overall menu option.  I love the fact that all their food is organic, and offer a fancier flare.  Their soups are quite delicious too, they don't have my favorite (chicken soup) at this location but it's just as comparable.  Their entree plates are quite yummy and filling too, I've had the enchiladas and they were really good.

Plane and simple, its the best organic Mexican food in the city.

Yum Yum Yum
author: J Y.

description:
Not nearly as tasty as the Potrero Hill location. The tacos I ordered, carne asada and Baja (fish), were both overcooked and surprisingly bland. Unlike the other location, they charge extra for the chips and salsa here, and the guacamole portion was disappointingly small. The ceviche was pretty uninspired. 

On the upside the raw tuna starter was quite tasty and they're friendlier here than in Potrero.
author: Luke A.

description: Food was great and fresh and good size. The server was very nice and very attentive. I liked how he checked with my girlfriend about the modifications that she wanted on her meal. Over all the place is good and great food at the same time. You can't forget about the great art work and the wonderful music that is playing in the background. The only reason why I'm giving it four stars it's bc the drinks sucked.
author: Antonio C.

description: I was generally very disappointed with this place. Food was generally dry and bland. Do not get the oysters they were not fresh and tasted really bad.
author: Alex I.

description:
I just went here last night and ordered the Super Fried Chicken Burrito. I thought it would be enormous and was planning on saving half to take home, but it was so delicious I somehow ate the whole thing. My friends ordered quesadillas and were also mmmmmm mmmmm good!!

One thing to note is that they won't let you sit down till everyone in your party is present. My friend and I were waiting for our 3rd friend and they wouldn't let us sit till she arrived.
author: Monica H.

description: Very good food with larger than expected portions.  The tacos were really tasty but I didn't really care for the salsa; maybe I just have goofy taste buds.  I'll certainly give this place a try again, maybe even have a margarita or two.
author: Brett D.

description: Best Mexican food I have had in a long time! Must try the quesadillas. I had the Pastor and I was drooling.
author: Zach S.

description: Small place but delicious food! We ordered the guacamole, vegetarian quesadilla, and shrimp tacos. All was delicious! And friendly staff.
author: Jacque O.

description:
GREAT prices for organic Mexican, GREAT portions, GREAT wait staff!

This is going to become my neighborhood go-to dinner
author: Eleanor C.

description: Omelette with poblano peppers and goat cheese didn't have any goat cheese in it. The salad on the side was wilted and brown. I asked someone for hot sauce and got this look like I had asked for no eggs in my omelette. Was not super impressed with the food or service. This place might be better if you're getting lunch or dinner items but there's a reason it wasn't crowded for brunch.
author: Fancypants J.

description:
Great food. Delicious tacos. Cool new place. 

My only drag is that they are clever in getting you to get an appetizer- they had a man with a thick accent (not our original waiter) come and offer us chips and salsa, or guacamole. Being that up until dining here, chips and salsa have always been complimentary. Turns out he was asking if we would like to order them, and with his super thick accent he talks about the difference between the options, and somewhere in his explanation he throws out that something is $3. Confused, we agreed to everything. We were hungry ;) 

Turns out we were charged $9 for guacamole and $3 for salsa. A little pricey, but it is Hayes Valley so not entirely surprised. Anyway I thought it was clever how they went about this offer, because had our actual waiter, who I could understand, offered this, we would have said just the salsa please! 

Would still come back, just with that in mind!
author: Alisha S.

description:
How does this place average 4 stars? Either the Yelp rating conspiracy is true or the people who left a high rating haven't discovered the Mission-or any other authentic Mexican taqueria in SF. 

$9 guacamole and you'd think it was made to order. Think again! It had a brown oxidized hue before being set down on the table. Tasted like the avocados used had gone bad. And the chips are AWFUL. 

Two of the three salsas weren't bad - I did really like the mango one. But what's free at every other Mexican joint costs $3 here. Not a big dollar item but its the principle...

Bland food and over priced. Decor is super cool. Glad I tried it but I'll never return. The Mission is only a 10 - 15 minute walk from this place-and there's even better Mexican than this place across from Safeway on Market...

Why is there no decently priced good food in Hayes Valley??? Well that's not fair-suppenkuche and lers Ros are amazing.
author: Howard G.

description:
Lame beans! (Quite literally since this is a Mexican restaurant!)

Positives (+): 
(+) I suppose it's a positive that they use "fresh" and possibly organic ingredients 

Negatives (-): 
(-) I've been told that a lot of Mexican restaurants do this, but I think it is incredibly unethical and untrustworthy to trick your customers by quickly asking them if they would like some guacamole as they are being seated while they are walking away. Then charging them $9 for it. So messed up. 
(-) The inside was full and so we decided to sit outside even though it was a bit cold (we didn't complain about it at all and it was our decision to sit outside). The server offered that he will put our order in as a rush so we wouldn't have to sit outside for as long. Another empty promise as we were sitting waiting for our food for a long while. 
(-) The food sucked! The duck confit burrito was riddled with bones, which was awesome to eat in a burrito! (Sarcasm). The tacos were dry and unsatisfying. Everything was just... unappealing. I'd probably say the best thing was the $9 guacamole I was tricked into buying! 
(-) No alcohol license - goodbye margaritas, cervezas, etc.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Overpriced, slow, vegetables were raw/not cooked. Salad drenched in bad dressing. Salsa way too sweet.
author: Briana B.

description: Great spot. Make sure to try the Churos, straight flames
author: Alex S.

description: Best Mexican I've had in the city. Burrito was amazing. Not particularly authentic but a tasteful interpretation.
author: L. H.

description: A step up from a taqueria in atmosphere and price. Their duck chilaquiles is seriously so good, and seriously sizable. When it arrived I did a double take because I was convinced all the food couldn't possibly be what I ordered (I ended up taking 1/3 home for later (good news: it's still tasty heated up two days later!)). My friend had the enchiladas which he quite enjoyed as well. Am glad to have another option in Hayes Valley, though I'm not looking forward to the inevitable line out the door here :/ When we were there they didn't have their beer & wine license yet, but this would be a great happy-hour-turn-dinner-because-you-had-one-too-many-spot.
author: jon y.

description: I couldn't decide if I would get more value (read: leftovers for lunch) by ordering a super burrito or a quesadilla, so my bf ordered the chicken quesadilla and I got a shrimp super burrito. What ended up happening after we split the queso fundido was that he ate two wedges of his quesadilla and I ate one wedge, and I brought my entire burrito home (we also each had a beer). There wasn't a line (on a Monday night) and the service was great. I would not mind returning for pricey "Americanized" burritos and quesadillas, but I would not get the queso fundido again. I'm not a queso purist by any means, but this really was more of a bean dip with some cheese melted on top, rather than a cheese dip with bits of other stuff in it.
author: Jenn C.

description:
First time at Papito - have seen it and thought about going, but the timing was finally right. Had 3 appetizer plates as dinner: albondigas (beef meatballs with mojita sauce, roasted pistachios, brussel sprouts, jack cheese & aged cotija cheese), esquites (grilled corn, sour cream, queso fresco with a cherry tomato pico de gallo) and ceviche mixto (baby octopus, shrimp, tilapia, salsa chile de arbol, cucumbers, wartermelon radish, avocado & butter lettuce). Everything was excellent and different from what I expected. For some reason I assumed the albondigas would be a soup - but was happy to have it they served it - tasty and unique. Esquites and ceviche mixto were quite refreshing, and all of it was plenty filling - could probably have split it for 2 people and had a decent light dinner.
Place is kind of small and tight, but I was comfortable - served quickly - staff was all "on the ball" - from the time you walk up outside, to seating, ordering and bringing out the order, filling water, checking on things - busy and friendly.
Given the quality of the food I did not think it was that pricey - especially not for the area.  I did go to the back hall to use the washroom, and did not see anything concerning - looked pretty clean and appropriate (well lit, soap and towels were well stocked, ...) to me.
All in all - I liked it and would definitely go back.
author: Jeff H.

description:
I've only moved to the area a few weeks back and was curious as to why there wasn't a good Mexican place in the core of Hayes Valley. Fortunately and simultaneously, Papitos was setting up, opened recently, and....it delivered! 

It's cozy, the servers are very nice and (almost too) attentive. The chips were okay but the guacamole was amazing. It had great flavor depth, not just your average slimed avocado  with salt and onion & tomatoes. 

I ordered the chicken fajitas--these were amazing. The chicken was glazed, leaving the perfect amount of sauce to drizzle over each tortilla but rich enough to give the meal a unique, delicious flavor.

Flan is a small portion but just perfect. I could've ordered another one! 

Only critique I'd add is don't offer chips and guac as if it's on the house, only to see it on the bill later. Minor, but sometimes I like to do a "instead of appetizer, get dessert" tradeoff. 

Overall, definitely a fun place with top quality flavor--whatever the cooking and organic ingredients, it's working! Right now they don't serve alcohol and let you bring your own. So I can't wait to see what cocktails they have. I'd definitely come back with a group.
author: Ari R.

description: Abject failure. Cold food. Food inundated with salsa to mask any other bad flavor that would otherwise emerge. Pass.
author: Greg M.

description: We tried it based on a recommendation from some friends. Found the food to be OK, not the best nor the most authentic Mexican, so just prepare yourself.  It is what you would find in a higher end Mexican fusion type of joint, just an american's take on Mexican food.  Overall we had a good experience, and the price was not that expensive, about $30 per person which included 2 apps, 2 dessert, pitcher of marg and dinner.  We will more that likely not return as this area has a lot better places to try. Also keep in mind that the wait was over an hour.
author: Frank C.

description: the food was OK, but the sangria and service was great. Maybe just drinks next time.
author: laura f.

description:
Inebriated, I was walking along the road to Damascus when a vision came to me -- a restaurant that I've never seen before! And I live here! I stood dumbfounded in front of the menu hanging in the doorway when a server peeked his head out at me.

Either out of his Catholic fervor to cure my culinary heresy, personal financial interest, or just to keep the traffic moving (I was standing in the doorway but to be fair, they could have had their menu facing the sidewalk), he ushered me in and sat me right down on the sleek modern counters. I must give the man credit for this interesting sell, and for this they get all the stars.

I remember the tortilla was hot and crispy, the meat and beans juicy, and then little else. I ate this at home.

But before I got home, I made one more stop -- a nearby bookstore (real books made of tree) where I purchased two works after much mental pacing: a collection of David Foster Wallace essays (Both Flesh and Not), which I could probably get online but as a child who grew up with books I bought anyway and have been enjoying thoroughly; and a book on Jackson Pollock and Lee Krasner called... well, I think it's called Jackson Pollock and Lee Krasner.

*** MAJOR DETOUR, also totally unqualified book review ***

Anyway, since I don't know who else to tell this to, that JP & LK book came across as a Lee Krasner Apologism. The Author (a certain Janet Engelmann) in the short space allowed for a book that is largely made up of reproductions of the artists' works, (seems to belabor) implies that Pollock was able to produce his greatest work (implied: "only") with the harmony and stability provided by LK. Funny, since it's LK who decides to (paraphrasing the author) join in the company of (and eventually extend marriage as an ultimatum to) JK once she realizes her time would be better spent pushing the young JK into the limelight than advance her own work (once again, paraphrasing the author).
