Also there's a lot of conflict including Kranser and Pollock; for a guy who was supposedly under the auspices of someone providing some emotional stability, he *did* die in a drunk driving incident that severely injured his mistress and killed her friend.

There's even a chapter titled "Pollock waning, Krasner waxing", which doesn't really make artistic sense since the only interesting part of this is the "Pollock waning" part, as he fades into steep alcoholism and depression.

And then there's some miserable outcome with the division of the deceased artist's works that involves not much of his family at all. I do think that the two really loved each other but...

But the book really just depresses me as someone who enjoys working creatively. I mean, he sorta did it to himself (as in, you can trace his arc) so I wouldn't say Poor Guy if *only* he could at least claim his artistic genius as part of that same affliction. That would be a much more interesting (and to me, plausible) tale.

So, note to artists out there -- staying alive is half the battle.

NOTE: I think 12 dollars is too much for a burrito in the land of burritos, but since it led to this book review I am giving it 5 stars. The book I give 2 stars.
author: Christophe C.

description: Worst service ever! Came in hoping to get a good burrito as I was starving after my run. Sat at the bar. Waitress came and gave us water immediately. We ordered. The chips and guacamole came out lightening fast (though the chips were stale and bland). We finished the big bowl of guac and chips. We waited for our food. The restaurant started to fill up. We continue to wait for our food patiently. The waitress looked at us several times but never said anything to us. We waited some more. After 35 mins of waiting, we asked the waitress to check on our order (being that everyone who came after us got their orders). The waitress comes back and explains that the computer backed up and our ticket never got printed. She offered to put our order in. At this point we were disappointed and pissed off. We declined and told her we had to leave. One would think the least they could do was to not charge us for the guac and chips. NOPE. They charged us. Needless to say, not coming back.
author: Kim D.

description: Probably some of the tastiest Mexican food in the city. Quality organic ingredients, very flavorful as well. We had a variety of vegetarian entrees and they all tasted solid and weren't just a bunch of beans + cheese like other Mexican restaurants. Totally going back here!
author: Anitha I.

description: Service was nice, the restaurant is cute, but I wasn't super in love with the food. I LOVE tacos but I didn't love these. I may go back again, but it won't be anytime soon.
author: Jam Rockah E.

description: "That place is good" "Gonna be dreaming about that burrito".  Solid innovative tastefully classy. Welcoming staff and attentive service. Visitors from SoCal we wouldn't hesitate to recommend to our friends. When the booze flows this place will be off the charts. Of note the veggie style quesadilla is delish.
author: Morgan G.

description: My bro and I returned to give Papito West another try and we experienced the quality they claim! The guacamole was very good, creamy yet with some avocado chunks, the shrimp and beef tacos were both tasty and flavorful. The brunch special was a very good surprise ( chilaquiles with extra egg and chicken) and the Flan we got for dessert is defiantly worth the treat!! David behind the bar offers a 5* service, I'll happily come back!!
author: Ferhat A.

description: The food was great, but the service need some work. We came on Wednesday afternoon. I ask the waitress/bartender if I can have the quesadilla without the cheese. She gave me an attitude and telling me that the cheese is the main ingredient,, well I know what quesadilla is, and that's why I ask without the cheese. I don't think I was asking too much. She could've been nicer about it. Not sure if I will be back.
author: Mila M.

description: Great food. Great service. We had a party of 6 and some other party didn't wanna get up after paying their bill so the host brought us amazing snacks and drinks to hold us over. We will definitely be back!!!
author: JUSTIN P.

description: From my first step to view the menu, Sarah was so welcoming and had a great smile. Even though the rest of my party had not arrived, 2 staff members offered me a drink and made sure I was taken care of. Not only was the food Delicious, but the service and friendliness was over the top! Job well done...,
author: Freida O.

description:
I had the guacamole, a carne asada taco & a grilled shrimp taco.  I also tried the trio of salsas.  The staff was nice & the place is a
small which is fine for small groups.  They had outdoor seating which is great. The food was ok, but not wow.  With so few organic options I would definitely go back.
author: N A.

description: God I wish all you folks in Hayes valley didn't love douchey restaurants. This place could've been perfect. Instead it's just the best place to eat in Hayes valley.
author: Erik R.

description: You know, I really do like the food at this place, but the prices are just outrageous so I have to lower the score to 3 stars. A $14 soup?!?!? $9 for guacamole?!?!? Burritos that start at $9 with no meat. Meat is at least $3 more. Come on. You're a small Mexican joint, not gourmet. At least have lunch specials. On and no free chips and salsa either. There's a reason all the other restaurants in the area are full at lunch with lines, when you have many available seats....
author: Guy P.

description: We were visiting family in San Fran who live around the corner from this little mexican restaurant so we decided to give it a try as Mexican food is my new obsession.   I ordered the fish tacos and vegetarian tacos.  They were SO Delicious.  Definitely surpassed my expectations.  The restaurant itself is long and narrow but very clean, and bright with the sky light.  The one downside is that they did not yet have there liquor license so I could not try the margarita.  I will definitely go back when I return to San fran.
author: Amanda B.

description: Restaurant has the cutest interior. Staff is pleasant. Food and drinks however are severely lacking. Guacamole was bland, veggie tacos/quesadillas/enchiladas all seem to be made from the same mix. Margaritas have a cool spicy mix around the rim but they too are bland.  If they could get a better chef, this seems like it would be a great spot.
author: Sheeba E.

description: Overpriced and semi-rude staff. We had take out and the portions were ridiculously small (for $30 salad and soup). They gave us like 5 chips in a bag and didn't include any tortillas with the $12 soup. Bummer.
author: Julie H.

description: Lovely atmosphere -- pretty art, wooden beams, skylight and romatic lighting -- and satisfying food. Although it looked busy, we got seated right away. We ordered chicken mole enchiladas, an appetizer of beef meatballs/brussel sprouts and the papito salad. Plenty of satisfying food for two, but the highlight was the margaritas - classic and blood orange with a chili salt rim. Yummy all around. There were no particular standout dishes and it was somewhat pricey for the simple ingredients in what we ordered - $35pp with one drink each. A solid option for pre-symphony or pre-ballet dining in Hayes Valley (2 blocks from both venues).
author: Annie M.

description:
Wow! You have to try the pozole!
I have also had the tacos which are fantastic.
Good service. Negro Modelo on tap!
author: Ken M.

description: A dropped in for a quick bite. The service was excellent. The fried chicken burrito was huge and tasted great.
author: Tal E.

description: The fried chicken tacos are the BEST I have ever had! The staff is very nice and friendly and their sangrias are the bomb.
author: Negar A.

description: Papito's was prettttty good--but expensive for what it is (especially when you can walk 15 minutes and go to El Castillito). I had chorizo con papas tacos ($9), my boyfriend had a quesidilla ($12) and we split rice/ beans ($4) and churros ($7). Everything was solid, but again, expensive.
author: Sydney L.

description:
Whoa 
I just had their pollo frito poached eggs which is essentially a fried chicken eggs Benedict. It basically is the definition of brunch and was INcredible. The service was very friendly and I dug the casual atmosphere. Can't wait to come back and try more :) Yummm
author: Marie V.

description: Loved their veggie enchilada and the papito salad!! I am not a big fan of salads, but their papito salad is absolutely amazing!! The service was pretty quick too!!
author: Madhura D.

description: If you're in Hayes Valley and hungry, this place is a solid choice that (usually) has no lines and serves awesome Mexican food. Somehow, my wife and I have disappointed in all the HV places, but this one remains our favorite.
author: Vladimir K.

description: I was looking forward to trying this place and craving a good Mexican meal and I was very disappointed.  The carnitas and Carne asada tacos were Way over cooked.  When my server finally came around to ask me how my meal was (after I was almost finished), I told him about my over cooked tacos and he just walked away.  I wanted to like this place because it looks warm and welcoming, but I don't think I'll come back.  They also need to work on their salsa's...not very flavorful.
author: Nicole M.

description: My favorite Mexican style breakfast and a great addition to Hayes Valley.  Tons of gluten free options and high quality food overall.  The guacamole is especially delicious as were the duck tacos.
author: Chris A.

description: Nothing about the food or the portion size justify the prices ($$$) Server was on it but otherwise, I paid $20 for lunch (no bev) and left hungry. Had tiny (so so tiny) tacos with not a thing with them (no chips, no beans) and separately ordered a side of veggies. Fish on the taco was rubbery. The shrimp taco lacked any complex flavor and had a too sweet sauce. I might go back if they get a lunch special for a reasonable price but it seems the whole concept is designed to make you pay as much as possible. Even people who got $20+ lunch entrees were eating just their entree with not one other thing on the plate.  There's plenty of amazing Mexican food in town you can eat for a third of the price if you skip this spot.
author: Gabby G.

description: Yum! Their Fried Chicken tacos are delicious. Friendly accommodating staff, who were able to give us a delicious side of fried plantains, which were not an option on the menu. Our go-to place whenever we are in Hayes Valley!
author: Soher Y.

description:
Great food, fresh, well prepared and authentic. 
Friendly service, David the owner is very efficient, his staff is very helpful and customer oriented.
Must come by if you are around the area!
author: David Z.

description: We don't especially like Mexican food but they had a free table when other restaurants in Hayes Valley had waiting lists, so we gave Papito a chance.  So glad we did.  The meatball and Brussels sprout appetizer was fabulous. The entrée salads -- shrimp with frisee lettuce and house made cheese, and the jicama and carrot salad, were excellent as well.  We paid a few dollars more to add duck to the jicama salad, and wow, it was like an entire entrée of Peking/mole/ragout duck on the side of the salad.  Beer and wine selections were very good as well.  Server Chelsea made the evening especially pleasant with her recommendations and accommodating our requests that some ingredients be served on the side.
author: Charles C.

description: Had the enchiladas con mole and they were delicious. Also had the vegetarian fundido. Both were pretty good. The service was good.  The only drawback was the lukewarm water.
author: Chris H.

description: Tasty Mexican food with a twist. Duck tacos are moist and come with perfect relish. Carne asada quesadillas maybe the best you can have after a day of walking around SF... full of cotija cheese, tomato and Chile that tastes smoky, also the perfect size for someone hungry or to share with someone. Bartender and almost all service speaks Spanish! Gracias!!
author: Florencia G.

description: Stopped by here for lunch on a whim because my first 2 choices were closed at the time I wanted to eat (4pm on a Saturday) and was sooooo glad we did! The food was AWESOME. No alcohol available yet, but you can get the best horchata EVER.! :) I had some great oysters (options change depending on availability) and an amazing plantain & shrimp dumpling appetizer. For my main course I had the shrimp quesadilla with mango chutney - so good! My friend had a steak burrito which he said was excellent. Ended the meal with a perfect flan. Service was excellent, too, and as a bonus, everyone who works there appears to be attractive. Hm!
author: Kim M.

description: Excellent fancy Mexican food. Fresh delicious and made with love. Service was friendly. Place is very clean. Mural on the wall is pretty.
author: Matt K.

description:
we came here for dinner last night before the new order concert.  they don't have a bar yet, so there were no drinks available other than agua fresca and horchata.  

three of us shared a ton of stuff:  crudo, the green beans, corn and black bean dish, carne asada big plate, and 4 tacos.  the server forgot my shrimp taco and gave us a carne asada one by accident, so he gave me a shrimp taco for free, so we had 5 tacos! 

everything was pretty good, but i particularly liked the green beans w/ the fried garbanzos on top.  the duck confit taco was also a standout.
author: Helen T.

description: So happy we finally have a decent Mexican place in Hayes Valley! I ate there last week, the food was fantastic and service was excellent. The staff is very attentive and made good recommendations on the menu. Since this was my 1st visit, I elected to try something standard and ordered a steak burrito. The burrito was huge, filled with fresh ingredients and well seasoned. The burritos are large enough to share with your date. I don't think they have alcohol on the menu yet, waiting for the city to approve their ABC permit. I'll definitely return on a regular basis.
author: Giselle B.

description: Tried out this place with some friends on a Saturday night. The wait time was about. 20-30 mins but worth it. The chicken enchiladas were really delicious. The red wine sangria was pretty good too.
author: Neelima K.

description: Another great Mexican spot. Good food, atmosphere and...food. Get the duck confit burrito.
author: Andrww B.

description: Great guacamole, sangria and love that they have a kids menu! The outside seating is nice, it's such a treat to dine al fresco in SF. The restaurant is small but artfully decorated. Staff was very nice.
author: S G.

description: Excited to see the enhanced (double the options) offerings of cute and fun Papito in Potrero Hill. Fabulous food (don't miss the chips w/ three homemade salsa options) and fun vibe.
author: Vicki L.

description: This is a very exquisite Mexican diner.  The interior is very modern Mexican.  I ordered Huevos Rancheros. It's delicious.  The seating's comfy and the wait staff are attentive.
author: Wing W.

description: Everything is amazing. Tried the chorizo burger, several tacos, ceviches, burrito. Service was excellent too. Must have.
author: Pavel R.

description:
Chilaquiles were delicious!! (you don't need the egg, but it's good) We had it with chicken and it was enough to feed two people for lunch.

The attractive host gave me a warm birthday hug- so what's not to love?  I wanted to sit outside, but it sure would be nice if they got outdoor heaters!

The tacos were very good, if not pricey. In fact everything is a little pricey. I'd stay away from the carne asada tacos, which were saucy and underwhelming.  Camarones Costenas were great. My co-diner devoured her chorizo con papas.

Unfortunately they charge for chips and small dishes of very spicy salsa. Service was very friendly and patient, which also meant that we waited a bit for unusual requests, like a cup of hot water....

I would go back for chilaquiles in a snap. And for a hug :)
author: Anna M.

description: Cold tacos with dry pork. I have been here several times but today it was quite disappointing.
author: Chris S.

description: A small, cozy Mexican restaurant in Hayes Valley with very good food and wonderful, patient, friendly servers. The decoration is pretty and goes very well with the name and the food. The sangria is very good, with the right amount of fruit and a balanced acidity. Plates are small, but they will satisfy your hunger.
author: Lindsay K.

description: Incredible food! We started with the heirloom salad which was so fresh and tasty. We had the shrimp, fish and steak. All super tasting!!!
author: Denise V.

description:
Good try! Efficient service and good music.
Really tasty food, and some plates definitely deserve a place in your mouth!
author: Benjamin O.

description: My new fav. Mexican place in my 'hood. I love their decor and service is pretty friendly.  Good crowd for any night. Menu has  many options, including duck confit, food comes quick and looks presentable.  4 not 5 since it is a little pricy  and my beef taco was overcooked...but the overall experience is still worth it
author: Jenya B.

description: I can't believe I have lived so close to Papito for 5 months and had not been until yesterday. We were walking by with our dog and I saw Tres Leches Cake on the menu and told my boyfriend, "We're stopping and eating here right now." (I had just told him the night before how Tres Leches cake is one of my all time faves so I saw it as a fated encounter). I am so glad that I listened to my intuition as we ended up having the most lovely + delicious brunch -- which included soooo much more than just a slice of their sensational Tres Leches Cake. Our server, Chelsea, also made the experience as she was so friendly, gave us exceptional service, and ensured our four-legged companion was well looked after (he got more than enough tortillas). Our first meal at Papito was one of the best I have had since moving to SF, I'm just so sad I didn't know about it sooner. Oh well, now it's time to make up for lost time and go back again (and again and again).
author: Carrie J.

description: Good food, interesting preparations, lovely waitstaff. But oh so noisy.
author: Sherri C.

description: yum, duck confit taco, duck confit burrito and duck confit quesadilla.
author: Wakako U.

description: If you like Chez Maman (across the street from here), you will certainly love this because the same inviting greeting is waiting for you and a very warm and friendly staff will make sure you enjoy your visit.  Chicken super burrito for me with salsa and chips.  It was in the midst of my work day and I didn't have a lot of time.  The food came quickly and tasted delicious.  The organic flour tortilla was so good, I could have easily eaten it with nothing inside.  Burritos are sometimes a bit soggy in spots.  Not this one.  My burrito was flavorful from end to end.  The owner, Jocelyn, recognized me from my work and came over to introduce himself and chat with me.  The server told me that weekend brunch will be served and showed me the menu.  Mexican is certainly the dominant theme here but there are nice unusual additions.  Oyster bar is something I can really get into, so I know I will be back for that!  The shellfish platter, crudo, and ceviche Papito are all on my list for future visits.  It was nice to see that desert isn't ignored.  Among the end treats are churros in chocolate sauce and traditional Mexican flan.  I'll have to be sure to save room!  Oh and everything is available to go, so that's another option.  All in all a very satisfying visit and I must certainly will be back!  Oh yeah and I'm telling all my friends too.
author: Michael F.

description:
dude, i am so bloated, that's all i gotta say.

in conclusion : salty af
author: Jane B.

description: Creative. I've had the duck burrito which was pretty good. I like the sweetness in it. It was unexpected but worked well with the duck. Could have used a touch more heat or acid to counterbalance the richness of the duck. The second time I tried the tacos. Nice corn tortilla. The fish was excellent. The carnitas was pretty good. The chorizo was wholly unremarkable. The biggest star for me has been the habanero salsa. You have to request it but if you like hot food it is awesome. Roasted habaneros; the sauce is black. The heat is forward as well as deep. Yum. The biggest detractor for me is having to interact with the rudest server. Just because you're smiling at me doesn't make your words or the tone of your voice pleasant.
author: Mayank S.

description: Boo and hiss!  What a HUGE disappointment.  Came here based on great reviews but food was just whatever all around - I could use 'meh' here which is fitting but won't..... We appreciate the organic nod but not at the expense of complex flavors.  Food looked nice but seemed almost like they are going for the tourist crowd.  Food deemed "spicy" was far from.  If anything, food was overly garlic-y.  Ordered waiter's recommendations.....will NOT be coming back.
author: Kate W.

description: Nice surroundings (cool mural) and fine service give way to perhaps some of the worst Mexican food I've had in the city. Fish and shrimp tacos fried beyond recognition. Enchilada and quesadillas a gloopy flavorless mess. Black beans side just a cheese delivery vehicle. Better tortillas could be found at Ralph's. Wine paired terribly. The great reviews Ive seen must be the owners friends as they are inexplicable.
author: Matthew H.

description: Poor at handling allergic costumers. The food was very tasty but unfortunately had leave on a rush to go get a Benadryl. Im allergic to tomato and even after saying it multiple times and asking what things in the menu I could eat I got served a burrito with tomato sauce inside. Would love to return but I can risk going to restaurants that aren't careful with allergies to food
author: Viviana B.

description: I really liked the burritos at this place. Service was also friendly.
author: Hannah M.

description: Everything was good but their oyster was a disappointment. It was borderline disgusting. Everything else was good though. Expect to pay about $30 per person including tip.
author: J C.

description: Nice job transforming the narrow space.  Good service.  Food was just ok.  Pineapple in dishes seems like a gimmick, not something that works out too well.  Beer battered cod taco was the best item.  Jicama salad was a wet mess.  I would much rather eat at Tacolicious for this type of mexican food.
author: Neo M.

description: I like the fish tacos. The guacamole is pretty good. Menu is expanded from the Portrero location. Not sure why there are 100,000 people here and the wait is 40 mins. There are good things, and I know - Mexican food in the Bay is pretty lame - but a 40 min wait?  I'm baffled. Chalk it up to another "I don't get SF yelpers because I guess I've lived here too long to relate."
author: Carmen A.

description: Awesome new place in Hayes Valley!! Gracious owner and friendly staff, it's a small place but it's cozy! I had the poblano pepper omelette that was super flavorful and perfect! My bf had the chilaquiles that were equally as awesome. This is a new must try! Get the horchata with a shot of espresso!
author: Elle J.

description: Tourists to San  Fransisco yummy fresh Mexican was on our to do list. Stumbled across papito and wasn't disappointed. Duck Fajitas and guacamole particularly good but nothing disappointed. GreAt service also. Only sorry we can't go again
author: Jf L.

description: We were on business in Hayes Valley and we went to Papito West, which I was told just opened. This neighborhood really needed a restaurant that offered great Mexican food. It is small but very comfortable and homey. Anyway, it has excellent organic food from the duck confit and shrimp tacos to the quesadilla and the burrito. Each meal was a big portion, fresh and very tasty. This is my favorite Mexican with a French touch that doesn't exist anywhere else. All the staff are very friendly and took care of us. We enjoyed our meals and visit. I do recommend this restaurant.
author: Keith D.

description: So this is my fourth time coming in since it has been opened and wasn't very satisfied. food was very bland my burritos are always perfect but today was very soggy and way to much salt also I realized that their chicken chilaquiles are the same exact ones as Mamacita sells but here they were horrible. Will not be going back.
author: Kristina P.

description: On the plus side, they have a lot of gluten free items on the menu, which is a necessity for me because I'm celiac. I had two tacos, Al Pastor and Carnitas with rice and beans. I was very disappointed in all of it. The carnitas were juicy, but had an odd flavor which I couldn't quite identify, sort of like cherry or pomegranate. Whatever it was, it was a bit overpowering and did not enhance the dish. The Al Pastor was also disappointing. It wasn't cooked on a rotisserie, it was just a few cubes of pork which were tough, and the spices didn't permeate the meat. I found the green sauce to be bitter, which is not flavor I associate with good Al Pastor. There were charred chiles in it, maybe Poblanos? and those get really bitter if the skin is charred. The rice and beans were extremely ordinary and were quite dried up. Even with organic ingredients, $4.50 for a TINY street taco seems a bit steep. Once again, it's great to have GF options, I just wish they were better prepared. The service was good, and I am willing to give them another try, but so far, I am not impressed.
author: michelle c.
